loans.name: Kuña Pora Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Pora está en su ciclo número 7 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. En  la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza 5 se  encuentran en el nivel 1 de  la línea de pobreza, es decir en una pobreza extrema.
Isabel integra este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas, comenta que sus ventas lo hacen de manera ambulante, y que de esta forma tiene los medios para poder dar a su familia lo que necesitan para una mejor vida. Ella es una persona que se está esforzando para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos por medio de su trabajo. Comenta que su meta es poder tener algún día una tienda grande donde poder ofrecer todo tipo de prendas para a sus clientes. 
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas como ser remeras, shorts, camisillas, pantalones, polleras, toallas. Ella está contenta por formar parte de este grupo, ya que con ello puede mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Kuña Pora" is in its seventh loan cycle through the women's program, and all the members work and help each other to get ahead.  On the poverty elimination survey they are at level 1 which means extreme poverty.

Isabel is a member of the group and she sells clothing.  She says she works as a street vendor and is able to earn an income to give her family a better lifestyle.  She is someone who makes every effort to help her loved ones through her work.  Her goal is to have a large shop one day to sell all kinds of clothing to her customers.

The loan she is requesting is to buy t-shirts, shorts, pants, skirts and towels.  She is happy to be in the group because she is able to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy t-shirts, shorts, pants, skirts and towels.

loans.name: Primicia Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Primicia está en su ciclo número 14 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permite conocer la situación de vida de cada una, y conforme a ello poder ir mejorando poco a poco.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Zunilda, una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, ella comenta que todos los días empieza su jornada de trabajo muy temprano, ya que prepara sus comidas y después sale a venderlos por su barrio. Comenta que tiene una buena clientela que siempre compra de ella las delicias que hace y con ello tiene los medios para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Ella pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos varios para poder hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, condimentos, hortalizas, carne, pollo y demás, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo, deleitando a sus clientes. Agradecen todas por la oportunidad que reciben de poder seguir creciendo y mejorando cada día.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Primicia" is in its 14th women's program loan cycle, and all the members work and help each other to get ahead.  They are part of the poverty elimination program which allows them to know what situation they are in in order to improve little by little.

One of the members is Zunilda who is a hard-working, enterprising woman.  She says every day she starts work very early because she must prepare food which she sells in the neighborhood.  She claims to have steady customers who buy from her regularly so she is able to earn an income to improve her living conditions.

She is requesting the loan to buy a variety of goods to make food, such as vegetables, seasonings, leafy greens, meat, chicken and other ingredients.  This way she will be able to continue with her sales work and satisfy customers.  

All the members are grateful for the opportunity to continue growing and improving day after day.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, seasonings, leafy greens, meat, chicken and other ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Ersilia

texts.es:
Ercilia es una persona muy trabajadora que esta luchando para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida a través de su arduo trabajo. Ella comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso para poder comprar hortalizas, y verduras y otros, de manera a que pudo ir cumpliendo con las demandas de sus clientes.
Agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que recibe de poder acceder al préstamo, y poder comprar nuevamente hortalizas verduras y demás.
texts.en: Ercilia is a very industrious person who is struggling to improve her living conditions through her hard work.  She says she used the previous loan to buy leafy greens, vegetables and other goods to meet customer demand.  She is grateful for this new opportunity and will buy leafy greens, vegetables and other goods once again.

loans.use: To buy leafy greens, vegetables and other goods.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
El Sr. Edgar es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 29 años, es soltero, es una persona que se esfuerza cada día poder sobresalir y mejorar su vida y sus ingresos.
Se dedica como vendedor ambulante de artículos de mercerías, como ser prendas, calzados y otros. Tiene una clientela formada, que siempre compra de él los productos que tiene.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar jeans, remeras, camisas, calzados y demás, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Edgar is from the city of Santaní, is 29 years old, single, and is a person who works hard every day to improve himself, and improve his life and his income.

He works as a street vendor selling merchandise such as clothing, shoes, and more. He has a set customer base, which always purchases the products he has.

He asks for this loan to be able to purchase jeans, t-shirts, shirts, shoes, and more, in order to be able to continue with his sales as he has been doing.

He is grateful for the opportunity that he is getting to be able to continue growing.

loans.use: to purchase jeans, t-shirts, shirts, shoes, and more.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.es:
El   Sr. Virgilio es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 45 años, es padre de 3 hijos, por quienes él está luchando para poder darles una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Se dedica como vendedor ambulante Artículos varios de mercerías y también de bijouteries. Él es una persona que está poniendo todo de sí, para poder ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida, y dar a sus hijos todo lo que el no pudo tener.
Virgilio pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas varias, calzados, bijouteries y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo y con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de mejorar sus vidas.
texts.en:
Virgilio is from the city of Santaní, he is 45 years old and the father of 3 children, for whom he is struggling to be able to give them a dignified life without deprivation. 

He works as a street vendor of a variety of merchandise and also costume jewelry. He is a person who is putting his all into being able to improve his living conditions and give his children everything that he couldn't have. 

Virgilio is asking for this loan to be able to purchase a variety of clothing articles, shoes, costume jewelry, and more, to be able to continue with his work and with his sales as he has been doing. He is grateful for this opportunity that he is getting to improve their lives.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothing, shoes, costume jewelry, and more.

loans.name: Scharles

texts.es:
El Sr. Scharles tiene 31 años,  es soltero, vive con su madre, es de la ciudad de Caaguazú.
Don Scharles se inició en este rubro hace más de 10 años,   aproximadamente,  comenzó con el capital  que junto ejecutando un instrumento musical que es el órgano, con un grupo musical, en la actualidad sigue con tocando y a la vez realiza trabajos de compra venta de artículos electrónicos, que le permite tener mejores ingresos.
Este préstamo  le servirá para comprar pendrives, cámaras fotográficas, etc., lo cual ayudaría a mejorar sus ingresos y poder continuar con sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Scharles is 31 years old, single, lives with his mother, and is from the city of Caaguazú.

Scharles began in this field more than 10 years ago approximately. He began with capital that the saved from playing a musical instrument, that is the organ, with a musical group, and currently he continues playing and at the same time he works buying and selling electronics, which allows him to have more income. 

This loan will serve him to purchase pen drives, cameras, etc., which would help him to improve his income and be able to continue with his income.

loans.use: to purchase pen drives, cameras, etc.

loans.name: Mirta

texts.es:
La señora Mirta, es casada, vive con su marido y sus hijos, en la ciudad de Villa Elisa, ella se encuentra trabajando en una lomitería desde hace varios años, cuenta con una clientela ya formada, también le prepara la comida a los empleados de los negocios que se encuentra alrededor de su casa.
Mirta pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para poder seguir haciendo sus comidas, como ser carne, verduras, aderezos, condimentos y otros, de manera a poder seguir deleitando a sus clientes con sus comidas.
texts.en:
Mirta is married and lives with her husband and their children in Villa Elisa. She has been working at a "lomito" (steak sandwich) stall for many years and has a fixed customer base. She also prepares food for the employees of businesses around her home.

Mirta is asking for this loan in order to be able to buy various supplies to continue making her food, like meat, vegetables, seasonings, condiments, and more. This will help her to continue preparing the meals her customers enjoy.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, seasonings, condiments, and more.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La Señorita Ana proviene de una familia  muy trabajadora,  sus padres se separaron siendo ella muy pequeña, pero siempre recibió apoyo de los mismos para seguir sus estudios.
Siendo mayor abrió una casa de ventas de celulares primeramente  y a la vez vendía ropas varias para poder terminar la carrera de enfermería. Concluyó sus estudios con mucho esfuerzo y ahora mismo buscando trabajo para ejercer su profesión. A la vez realizando  sus ventas.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas varias para la venta, de manera a poder seguir luchando por mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Ana comes from a hard-working family. Her parents separated when she was very small, but they always helped her to continue her education.

When she grew up, she first opened a store selling mobile phones, and she also sold clothing, in order to be able to obtain her degree in nursing. Due to her endeavours, she managed to finish her studies and is now looking for work in her profession. At the same time, she is selling clothes.

She is asking for this loan to be able to buy various pieces of clothing for selling, and by this she wans to continue increasing her income.

loans.use: to buy various pieces of clothing for selling.

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es:
Ramón es de la ciudad de Itá, se dedica a la jardinería para poder solventar sus estudios, a la vez que estudia también trabaja. Y su mayor aspiración es poder egresar como un contador para ser un profesional  exitoso
Él está poniendo todo de sí para poder crecer  salir adelante, y cumplir con su meta de ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus útiles de la universidad y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Ramón is from Itá. He works in gardening in order to pay for his studies, because he studies in addition to his job. His great aim is to graduate as an accountant and to become a successful professional.

He is putting all he has into growing and getting ahead to reach his goal to become someone in life.

He is asking for a loan to be able to buy the equipment he needs for university, so that he will be able to continue his studies.

loans.use: to muy materials for university.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 33 años, es pareja de la Sra. Nilsa, vive en la ciudad de Caacupé, se dedica a la construcción de obras, que ya hace ya 15 años, se encuentra trabajando con un arquitecto quien realiza los contratos y formaliza los planos y presupuestos de acuerdo a la necesidad del cliente, por lo cual tiene muchas demandas por el buen trabaja que lo caracteriza.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de cemento y cal para poder usar en sus obras, como también para la compra de herramientas.
texts.en:
Juan is 33 years old, his partner is Nilsa, and they live in Caacupé. Juan does construction work. He has worked in this trade for 15 years already, and he works with an architect who makes the contracts and the plans and cost estimates with the client. Therefore, there is a high demand for Juan's good work.

He is asking for this loan to buy cement and lime to use it for construcctions, and also to buy tools.

loans.use: to buy cement, lime, and tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, and metal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, metal, cement, and gravel.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for expenses related to school, like school supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dairy products like hard cheese and corn meal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy acetic acid and spices, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Rhea

texts.en:
Rhea, 33, is a married woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rhea has a dried-fish making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Rhea requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish, salt and other materials for her dried-fish making.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish, salt and other materials for her dried-fish making.

loans.name: Tchotcho

texts.fr: Tchotcho est une femme mariée de 52 ans qui vit à Lomé dans le quartier d’Adamavo avec ses deux enfants qui ne sont pas scolarisés. Pour contribuer à l’épanouissement de la famille, elle vend des noix de palmes pour avoir une rentabilité considérable. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des fournisseurs du quartier une fois par mois. Tchotcho demande ce crédit pour financer l’achat des noix de palmes et ainsi faire plus de bénéfice et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en: Tchotcho is a 52-year-old married mother to two children, who are currently not receiving an education. They live in the district of Adamavo. In order to contribute to her family's well-being, she sells palm nuts. This business brings in a comfortable income. She gets her wares from local suppliers once per month. Tchotcho is requesting this loan in order to purchase palm nuts, so she'll be able to make larger profits and thereby provide her children with an education.

loans.use: to purchase 200 bowls of palm nuts

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a single woman. She has two children. She describes herself as honest. 

She operates a food stall where she cooks food for sale. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a productive area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate finances. 

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to open a hotel within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will own the biggest hotel in the area. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 10 years to 21 years. She describes herself as ambitious. 

She operates a restaurant where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge as insecurity. 

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to own a big hotel within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to the highest level. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Rhomileen

texts.en:
Rhomileen works hard to support her family. Rhomileen is married and has a dried-fish making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

Rhomileen requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish, salt and other materials for her dried-fish making.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish, salt and other materials for her dried-fish making.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
As a married parent of eleven children, Salvacion works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from fishing.  

Salvacion is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to  purchase more stocks to sell like noodles, canned goods, soap, coffee, milk, sugar, etc. for her general store business.

Salvacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like noodles, canned goods, soap, coffee, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to enable her husband to purchase a new auto rickshaw body and seat covers.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Âgée de 41 ans, Akossiwa est une femme mariée et vit à Lomé avec son mari et ses quatre enfants. Elle a mis au point une petite alimentation générale qui lui procure de la rentabilité pour leur survie. Elle s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché d’Akodessewa. Akossiwa demande ce crédit pour équiper son étalage par l’achat des bidons d’huile et sacs de gari. Akossiwa compte tirer du profit et venir en aide à son mari dans les charges quotidiennes.
texts.en: Akossiwa is a 41-year-old married mother to four children who lives with her family in Lomé. She has set up a small business selling foodstuffs, which produces a liveable income for her family. She gets her supplies four times a month from the market in Akodessewa. Akossiwa is requesting this loan so she can stock her stall with containers of cooking oil and sacks of cassava flour. Akossiwa plans on making a profit from this venture so she can assist her husband with their family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of cassava flour and two containers of cooking oil

loans.name: Sereysokha's Group

texts.en:
Sereysokha’s Group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sereysokha works as farmer and she also does extra work buying and selling sugarcane juice to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help her safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Collins

texts.en:
Collins is a married man. He has six children. He describes himself as honest. 

He operates a food stall  where he cooks mandazi (fried dough) for sale. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing mandazi. His business goal is to be a supplier within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of ingredients for preparing mandazi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 20-year-old single man who lives with his family in Sana'a city, Yemen. Mohammed has a secondary education, but due to the miserable conditions of his family, he could not complete his studies. Mohammed's father decided to purchase for his son a minibus. Mohammed works as a driver on the bus 15 hours daily in order to make money for his family. Due to use, the bus has broken down and needs a lot of repair and maintenance. Unfortunately, most of what Mohammed earns goes to cover the necessary expenses of his family, and he doesn't have sufficient money to repair the bus. For this reason, Mohammed applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase some of the necessary spare parts to repair his bus.

Mohammed hopes to get married soon.

loans.use: To purchase some of the necessary spare parts to repair his bus.

loans.name: Put's Group

texts.en:
Put’s group live in a rural village near Phnom Penh city in Cambodia. Put makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a tailor and construction worker to support his family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Put to safeguard the health of his family, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Taze

texts.en:
These villagers are the 56-year-old Taze and her husband, Mark, a blind man. Taze had a milk cow before it had started to produce less and less milk as days went by; thus, she decided to sell it. With that money, in addition to the loan that she is requesting from lenders now, she will buy a new one that could produce up to 30 kg/day. Kindly note that cows produce milk all year around except the last two months of their pregnancy. In this case she purchased the cow and owes some money to those she bought it from, this is where the loan will go. 

Taze sells a baby calf per year and raw milk to some nearby dairy farms, about 9 liters per day, whereas the rest she uses for her own needs. All in all, Taze has about 16 dynym of agricultural land where she plants mostly corn and wheat. She sells about 20 quintals of corn and 6 quintals of wheat. The rest she uses as feed for her animals.

loans.use: to pay for the debt of her new cow.

loans.name: Dovi

texts.fr: Dovi est une femme mariée et âgée de 50 ans vit à Lomé avec ses cinq enfants. Dovi s’évertue de mettre à disposition de son ménage sa contribution pour son épanouissement. C’est en cela qu’elle vend des ignames frites à la devanture d’un bar du quartier et trouve une satisfaction du profit qu’elle tire. Dovi s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé. Dans le souci de répondre aux besoins de ses consommateurs, Dovi nécessite ce crédit pour acheter des ignames afin d’aménager la friture.
texts.en: Dovi is a 50-year-old married mother to five children who lives in Lomé. Dovi strives to contribute towards her family's well-being. This is the reason for her selling fried yams outside of a local bar, which brings in reasonable profits. Dovi gets her supplies four times a month from the main market in Lomé. In order to better meet her customers' demands, Dovi needs this loan to purchase the yams she needs.

loans.use: to purchase one bunch of yams, one container of cooking oil and two boxes of spaghetti pasta

loans.name: Rosa Gladis

texts.es: Rosa de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal desde hace varios años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y también vende de forma ambulantes por las diferentes colonias, Rosa está solicitando un crédito para la compra de perfumes, lociones, cremas, shampoo, desodorantes etc. todo por mayor y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 41, lives in her own house with her daughter.  Rosa has been selling personal use products for several years.  Her business is located at her house.  She also sells in an itinerant manner in different neighborhoods.

Rosa is requesting a loan to buy perfume, lotion, creams, shampoo, and deodorants, etc.  She will buy everything wholesale.  This way she will be able to continue with her work in order to have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy perfume, lotion, creams, shampoo, and deodorants, etc. wholesale.

loans.name: Ana Mirian

texts.es: Ana de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de panes con jamón vende en su carretón de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias,  con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Ana esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de panes, jamón, curtido mayonesa, mostaza, salsa dulce entre otros ingredientes ara seguir con sus ventas y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Ana, age 32, lives in her own house with her three children.  She sells bread with ham.  She sells from her cart in an itinerant manner in the different neighborhoods.  With what she gets from her sales, she manages to pay for some of the household expenses.

Ana is requesting a loan to buy bread, ham, coleslaw, mayonnaise, mustard, and sweet sauce, among other ingredients.  She will do this in order to continue with her sales and, in this way, to have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy bread, ham, coleslaw, mayonnaise, mustard, and sweet sauce, among other ingredients.

loans.name: Rocio Esmeralda

texts.es:
Roció, comenta que el crédito anterior le sirvió para que su negocio tenga materia prima para la elaboración de pupusas y antojitos, tiene nuevos clientes y sus ingresos han mejorado.
Está solicitando un nuevo crédito con el que tendrá recursos económicos para invertir en harina, aceite, quesillo, chicharrón, tomates, repollo, yuca, plátanos, etc., para elaborar las pupusas y antojitos de esa forma tendrá a sus clientes satisfechos.
texts.en:
Roció says that she used her previous loan for her business to have raw materials to make ‘pupusas’ [stuffed tortillas] and ‘antojitos’ [snacks].  She has new customers, and her earnings have improved.

She is requesting a new loan with which she will buy flour, cooking oil, soft cheese, ‘chicharrón’ [fried pork rinds], tomatoes, cabbage, yucca, and bananas, etc.  This way she will make pupusas and antojitos, and she will have satisfied customers.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, soft cheese, ‘chicharrón’ [fried pork rinds], tomatoes, cabbage, yucca, and bananas, etc.

loans.name: Asuntah

texts.en: Asuntah is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be faithful. She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy fertilizer. Her business goal is to have a large-scale business within five years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Apefa

texts.fr: Apefa, âgée  de 31 ans est une femme mariée qui vit avec ses quatre enfants dans le quartier de Lomé. Apéfa est une couturière et vend des habits qu’elle prend le soin de coudre elle-même. Elle s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé. Apéfa veut acheter des tissus pour coudre des vêtements destinés à la vente et nécessite ce crédit pour financer son achat et favoriser l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Apefa is a 31-year-old married mother to four children who lives in Lomé. Apefa earns a living as a seamstress and sells items of clothing which she makes herself. She gets her supplies three times per month from the main market in Lomé. Apefa wants to purchase fabrics which she can transform into clothing and then sell. She is requesting this loan to subsidise these expenses and to ensure that her children receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase four sheets of traditional pagne cloth

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is Rose. She is 43 years old and a single mother with two children. She is happy for the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa enterprise management training she received, which equipped her with skills to manage her business.

She is borrowing from Kiva to further expand her maize farming business by buying manure and fertilizer. She hopes this will help her boost her business and increase her income. This will enable her to improve the living standards of her family, which includes quality education and modern housing.

Rose is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Mayra Janeth

texts.es:
Mayra, se decidió por un nuevo crédito para comprar golosinas, jugos, huevos, arroz, pan, boquitas, entre otros productos con los que cubrirá las necesidades de sus clientes.
Con la inversión anterior ha mantenido la tienda funcionando, sus ingresos han mejorado y sus hijos tienen acceso a una mejor vida y educación.
texts.en:
Mayra has decided to take out a new loan to buy sweets, juices, eggs, rice, bread, and snacks, among other products, so that she can meet her clients' needs.

With the previous loan, she has kept the store up and running, her income has improved, and her children have access to a better life and education.

loans.use: to buy sweets, juices, eggs, rice, bread, and snacks among other products, in order to meet her clients' needs.

loans.name: Ayawavi

texts.fr: Ayawavi est une femme mariée âgée de 31 ans et vit avec ses trois enfants dans le quartier d’Adamavo à Lomé. Ayawavi vend des pagnes avec lesquels elle se promène de quartier en quartier pour répondre aux sollicitations de ses clients. Ayawavi s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché de Lomé pour collectionner ses  gammes de pagnes. Pour réaliser ses objectifs, Ayawavi sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des pagnes pour équiper son étalage.
texts.en: Ayawavi is a 31-year-old married mother to three children who lives in the Adamavo district of Lomé. Ayawavi walks from district to district as a street vendor, selling pagne cloth according to her customers' demands. Ayawavi gets her supplies four times per month from the market in Lomé, so she always has a wide variety of styles. In order to meet her goals, Ayawavi is requesting this loan in order to purchase pagne cloth so that her business remains well stocked.

loans.use: to purchase six sheets of traditional pagne cloth

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman. She has two children with ages 4 years and 10 years. She describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a farm where she grows vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

She will use the 40,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to be able to serve a wider clientele within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 15 years to 24 years. She describes herself to be hopeful. She operates a farm where she grows vegetables. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. 

She will use the 30,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will own a bigger farm. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is a married man. He describes himself to be hardworking. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. 

He will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy a motorcycle. His business goal is to have a fleet of motorcycles within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a better life. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of garments for her husband's business

loans.name: Rosilie

texts.en:
Rosilie is 36 years old and married with three children who are in school. Rosilie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Rosilie has been in this business for six years. 

In the future, Rosilie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Zoila

texts.en:
Zoila works hard to support her family. Zoila is married and has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines.

Zoila requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and pay for maintenance for her motorcycle transportation.

Zoila has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and pay for maintenance for her motorcycle transportation

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 40 years old, married, and had two children attending school. Her husband is a butcher, and also her partner in the food business. They cook and sell pancit (noodles topped with egg, meat or vegetables). She was new in this kind of business, but she hopes for a profitable and successful business someday. 

Now she is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy ingredients, meat and vegetables to cook and sell. 

She will continue selling delicious foods and gain good profits from it. She will reserve additional revenue for educational purposes.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, meat, and vegetables

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.en:
Nargiza is widowed. She was born in 1979 year. Nargiza is a careful mother to three children. She lives with her children in a village. 

Nargiza has been busy with an agriculture business more than 11 years. She grows wheat, onions, etc. Also, she has additional income from animal husbandry. Nargiza now has seven cows. She sells agriculture products and milk in a local market. She manages the business alone. Her working day usually begins early in the morning. 

She is going to sow her farm to get a good harvest, but she doesn't have the money. 

She is asking for a loan of 6,000 Somoni to buy mineral fertilizer for sowing the farm. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 2 years to 13 years. She describes herself to be reliable. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, salt, rice, flour, cereals and other items. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. 

She will use the 40,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to have a retail shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be self-sustainable. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Sanita

texts.en:
Sanita is 60 years old and is married. Sanita is the loving parent of three children who are now all married. While taking care of her grandchildren, Sanita manages her hog-raising business. At present, she is raising five hogs. 

At her age, Sanita still wants to raise more than the number of hogs she has now, but she can’t push it because of financial constraints. Thus, Sanita is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs. She hopes to grow the business by having more hogs to raise. It will be a big help for her to continue to run the business to be able to fulfill the family needs.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs.

loans.name: Samini

texts.en:
Samini is a married man. He describes himself to be sincere. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He also owns a retail shop where he sells sugar, bread, flour and other household items. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a populated place. 

He will use the 40,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy stock of sugar, rice, flour, bread and other items to sell in his retail shop. His business goal is to be successful within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy stock of sugar, rice, flour, bread and other items to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a conducive environment, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high prices. 

She will use the 50,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have more stores within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable life. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Loyce

texts.en: Loyce is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 1 year to 4 years. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in fashion. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy a sewing machine. Her business goal is to own a fashion line within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to service and maintain his motorcycle.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela works hard to support her family. Carmela is married and has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines.

She requested a 26,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of vegetables to sell.

Carmela has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Carmela would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Elena works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig raising. Elena is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to  buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 42 years old, married and has three children, two of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Gina requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Gina has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Elfrida

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Elfrida. Elfrida lives in East Serang, located about two hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city. She lives there with her husband and her two daughters. Elfrida is a full-time housewife and mother. She joined Ruma in 2013 and this is the second time she is applying for a loan from Kiva. She feels that, by joining Ruma, she can help her husband improve their life and learn about how to start up a business. She can also contribute more to her community. 

As the business grows, Elfrida is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends. Your loan will be very useful to help Elfrida improve her business and accordingly, her community which needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Elfrida is the one who is standing in her own small stall. She will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile payment services for her community.

loans.name: Muzeturihe Group

texts.fr:
Jeanine  fait partie du groupe  Muzeturihe  et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 42 ans et est mariée à Léonidas, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants âgés de 14 à 19 ans, tous étudient.
Elle a sous sa charge 2  membres de sa famille élargie dont 1 étudie. 

Elle fait le commerce de  tôles d'occasion  depuis  8 ans. 

Elle est à son dix-huitième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup  de tôles  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  vendre de tôles neufs, et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Jeanine is a member of the Muzeturihe group and lives in Gitega. She is 42 years old and married to Leonidas, a vendor. They have two children, 14 and 19 years old, both in school.She also has two other relatives as dependents, one of whom is in school.

She has been selling second-hand used metal sheets for eight years. She is on her 18th loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan, she will bolster her capital and buy a large quantity of sheet metal plates so as to increase her savings. In the years to come, she would like to start new  metal sheets and ensure that her children receive an education.

loans.use: to buy  metal sheets for resale.

loans.name: Mafudoh

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Mafudoh. Mafudoh  lives in East Serang, located about a two hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city. She lives there with her husband and her only child. Mafudoh works as a factory laborer. She joined Ruma since 2013. As a woman, she wanted to join Ruma because she wants to help her husband improve their life and learn about how to start up a business, as well as give more contribution to her community. 

As the business grows, Mafudoh is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends. 

Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Mafudoh improve her business and accordingly, her community who needs access to such services. 

As seen in the photo, Mafudoh is the one who is standing in her own small stall. She will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for his community

loans.name: Kiletien Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Mary, a member of Kiletien Women Group. She is thirty six years old, married and a mother of five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in March 2013 and has received training on enterprise management and financial management. These trainings have equipped her with skills in business management.

She grows maize and beans to earn a living. Mary is borrowing a loan in order to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and hybrid seeds. This will assist her to increase her farm output and thus boost her income. She will therefore be able to provide for family needs such as food and clothing. 

Mary is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to make established payments

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and hybrid seeds to improve productivity.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Dominic. He is 58 years old, married and blessed with nine children who are in school.

Dominic does crop farming of maize, beans and potatoes. The training he received from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa on enterprise management enables him to manage his business well. 

He is borrowing a loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and pesticides to boost his farming. This will ensure he maintains a consistent supply to the market, thus a stable income that he will use to support his children's education.

Dominic is very grateful to Kiva and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and pesticide that will boost his farming.

loans.name: Sumboka Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Josephene, a member of Sumboka Self Help Group. She is 29 years old. 

She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from training courses on enterprise development and financial management. She operates a scrap metal selling business. 

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to expand her business by buying more stock of scrap metal. She hopes her sales will improve, thus more income to cater for family needs such as food and clothing.

Josephene is grateful for the Kiva loan, and promises to make the established payments.

loans.use: To buy more stock of scrap metal

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is a married man. He has 1 child. He describes himself to be faithful. 

Hamisi operates a dairy farm where he sells milk. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a marketable place and his primary customers are of all kinds. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough animal feed. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more dairy cows. His business goal is to have a company within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve the living standards of his family. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more dairy cows

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La estudiante viene de una familia humilde, sus padres son Oleros, mediante ellos está luchando para poder ser una buena profesional. Ella está estudiando la carrera de Arquitectura.
Su aspiración es terminar  su carrera y comenzar a trabajar en algo de la rama de su Carrera  y de esa manera ser una  buena profesional,  tener un ingreso más seguro para su hogar, y ayudar a sus padres cuando lleguen a la tercera edad.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de universidad.
texts.en:
This student comes from a modest family, her parents are bricklayers. With their support, she is striving to become a professional.

She's studying architecture. Her goal is to obtain her degree and get a job related to her major, so that she can become a good professional. 

She aspires to generate a stable income for her home, and in the future to help her parents in their old age.

She is requesting this loan to be able to pay her university tuition.

loans.use: to pay university tuition fees.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be a go-getter. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high prices. 

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy hair braids and hair chemicals for salon use. Her business goal is to have a big salon in town within five years. 

She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.  The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy hair braids and hair chemicals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of cereals, flour, sugar and other items

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 2 years to 13 years. She describes herself to be sincere. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy and competitive area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough animal feed. 

Mary will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy animal feed. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a bedroom for the house.

loans.name: Jelma

texts.en:
Jelma is 30 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school, Jelma works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, shampoo, etc.

Jelma has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Jelma would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Romelin

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Romelin works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Romelin is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy more seafood to sell to customers.

Romelin has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more seafood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy crockery for resale by her husband.

loans.name: Kirathimo Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Magdaline, a member of Kirathimo Women's Group in Nakuru, Kenya. She is 50 years old, married, and a mother of three. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in November, 2014.

Magdaline owns a shop as her main business. With the training she got from HiH EA, she is able to manage her shop and thus increased profits out of this business. 

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase more stock of food stuffs such as sugar, salt and flour for the shop. This will greatly increase her income from sales, which will enable her to cater for her family needs, such as school fees.

Magdaline is grateful to Kiva and their lenders, and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy more stock of sugar, salt and flour

loans.name: Holien/bee Gichobo Project Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Edward, a member of Holien/bee Gichobo project group. He is 66 years old, married, and has nine children.

Edward does crop farming of maize, beans, and potatoes, and also sells cabbages. The training he received from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa on enterprise management has enabled him  manage his business well. 

He is borrowing a loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and manure to help crop productivity. He looks forward to more income that he plans to use in providing basic needs to his family.

Edward is very grateful to Kiva, and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has five children. She operates a farm where she grows maize and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for seven years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor weather. 

Mary will use the Kes 70,000 loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs. Her business goal is to be able to produce more within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be self-dependent. This is her fifth loan  with  SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her  farming.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
Nasiba was born in 1970. She is widowed and has two children. She works hard from early morning till late evening to earn a living. Nasiba offers the service of taxi driver and also, she is a hairstylist. Nasiba has been busy with these two businesses for more than 10 years. 

Nasiba always tries to offer high quality living conditions for her children Nafisa and Jahongir. Nasiba is going to repair her Opel car and in this way attract more clients. She is asking for a loan of 15,000 Somoni with this aim. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to repair her car that is used as a taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of bed covers

loans.name: Frecil

texts.en:
Frecil works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to by additional fishing net.

Frecil has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Frecil would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to by additional fishing net

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw material for manufacturing iron accessories for her husband's shuttering work

loans.name: Lizandra

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lizandra  works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Lizandra  is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to  buy additional household goods to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, etc. for her general store business.

Lizandra  has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional household goods to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Ericka Jessenia

texts.es:
Ser enfermero no es una labor fácil, se debe poseer mucha paciencia y dedicación para realizar  este trabajo social,  donde  la mayoría de veces, el  cansancio y agotamiento doblega hasta el más fuerte cuerpo, pero  la satisfacción por haber ayudado, hace que todo haya valido la pena. Ericka, aspira a ser una gran enfermera pues el amor a ayudar a otros es la principal motivación para escoger esta área de la medicina, algo subestimada por algunos. 
Ericka solicita el financiamiento a MiCrédito, para solventar los gastos de su titulación, esto le será beneficioso porque podrá ejercer su carrera y ganar experiencia. Además, planea estudiar inglés, pues considera una herramienta esencial para su desarrollo como profesional. Ella se siente muy agradecida con su  mamá pues ha sido el sustento de su hogar y ahora que está por graduarse, sabe que podrá aportar a la economía de su hogar.
texts.en:
Nursing is not an easy profession. One needs a healthy dose of patience and dedication in order to serve society in this way. Very often, even the strongest individual will surrender to utter exhaustion at the end of the day, but the satisfaction of having helped someone makes it all worthwhile. Ericka wants to excel in her chosen profession, her main motivation being her eagerness to help people. This led her to choose a medical profession somewhat underestimated by people.
Ericka asks MiCrédito for a loan to pay for professional registration fees. She needs to be registered to practice her profession and become an experienced nurse. She plans to learn English, a language she considers essential to her professional advancement. She is very grateful to her mother for supporting her through nursing school. Now that Ericka is on the cusp of graduating, she takes comfort in the fact that she will from now on contribute to household expenses herself.

loans.use: to pay for professional registration fees.

loans.name: Tushauriane Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Jane, a member of Tushauriane Self Help Group in Nakuru, Kenya. She is fifty-seven years old, married, and blessed with seven children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in July 2013.

Jane grows maize, beans, and bananas in her small farm. She is grateful for the HiH EA enterprise training that has enabled her to commercialize the farming business. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase farm inputs such as manure to help increase yields and get  better income thus enable her to provide basic family needs such as education, medical care and clothing.

She is happy with Kiva and their lenders for their intervention and  promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy manure that will help improve crop productivity

loans.name: Berta Lilian

texts.es: Berta de 51 años de edad vive sola en casa propia, ella tiene un negocio de salón de belleza desde hace 14 años en su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, ella solicita un crédito para poder comprar productos para su salón de belleza como: cremas, shampoo, ganchos para el cabello, toallas, tijeras, entre otras cosas que necesita y así seguir con su trabajo para obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Berta is 51 years old and lives alone in her own house. 

She has been running a beauty salon for the last 14 years, in the house where she lives. With her earnings she manages to cover her household expenses. 

She is requesting a loan to buy products for her salon such as creams, shampoo, hairpins, towels, scissors, and other things she needs. With these she can continue her work and increase her income, which will help her reach better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy creams, shampoo, hairpins, towels, scissors, and other things she needs.

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be loyal. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a highly populated area and her primary customers are of all types. 

Dora will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to be the leading tailor within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve the living standards of her family. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 57 years old and has seven children. She is married and has one child who is still in school.

Erlinda is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional pigs, feed and vitamins for pigs.

Erlinda has been in this business  for four years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs, feed, and vitamins for pigs

loans.name: Ngeleno Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Silvia, a member of Ngeleno Women Group. She is a twenty-six-year-old married mother of three children. She lives with her husband and children.

She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from training on enterprise development and financial management. This has helped her improve her knowledge on business management. Her economic activity is dairy farming. 

Silvia needs a loan to buy high quality fodder for her cows. This will increase the milk production and help Silvia keep up with the increased demand for milk. She hopes this will increase her level of income in order to continue supporting her family and in the long run improve their living conditions.

Silvia is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: To buy fodder for dairy cows.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Norah: fifty-four years old, married, and blessed with eight children.  She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in November 2013.

She practices maize, beans and poultry farming businesses. She  is grateful for the enterprise training she got from HiH EA which has enabled her to acquire knowledge and skills to run her enterprise well. She is applying for a Kiva loan to purchase poultry feed and mineral supplements for her chickens. This will help improve her productivity hence meet the rising demand for eggs and chicken in her locality. Norah’s income will thus improve and she will be in a position to meet her family needs such as food and education for her children.

Norah is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed and mineral supplements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Christina. She is 40 years old, married and has six children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from training on enterprise development and financial management. This has helped her improve her knowledge of business management.

Christina's economic activity is potato and onion farming. She is borrowing money to lease land for onion farming. This will improve her output; thus, increase her level of income and ensure she supports her family. In the long run, it will improve her living conditions including medical care.

Christina is very grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: To lease land for onion farming

loans.name: Sophea's Group

texts.en:
Living in Ponhea Krek district, Kampong Cham province, Sophea is a 33-year-old married woman with two young children who are her dependents. They are in primary and secondary school. 

To earn a living, Sophea has been planting rubber for 13 years. In addition, when she has free time from her plantation, Sophea works for other rubber plantations as a paid-worker to earn extra income. She manages to save roughly 5 USD a day. This is her first time being a member with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner.

Leading her group, she is applying for a loan of 4,200,000 KHR for them. Her portion of the loan will be used to buy fertilizer for her rubber plantation. She hopes that the plantation will produce more yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rubber plantation.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Seu

texts.en:
Seu is 43 years old with 6 children. She operates a small business selling chicken and chips in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year.

Seu has requested a loan to buy a sack of taro, sacks of potatoes, vegetable oil, frying pan and wooden spoons to assist her with the business. She will use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's daily needs.

Seu joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of taro, sacka of potatoes, vegetable oil, frying pan and wooden spoons.

loans.name: Tualua

texts.en:
Tualua is a 28 year old unmarried woman with 4 children. She makes and sells meat pies in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business.

Tualua needs a loan to buy bags of flour, yeast, olive oil, a large frying pan, a gas oven and baking trays. She plans to use her profits to pay for her children's education.

Tualua has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, yeast, olive oil, a large frying pan, a gas oven and baking trays.

loans.name: Alafaga

texts.en:
Alafaga is a 26 year old mother with 2 children. She owns and operates a small business selling pancakes, pork cakes and buns in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year.

Alafaga has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, sacks of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoons and a frying pan to assist her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to build a small bakery store in the near future.

Alafaga joined SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sacks of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoons and a frying pan.

loans.name: Rosan

texts.en: With her desire to help her husband even in a simple way, Rosan engages herself in raising pigs. Rosan is 34 years old, married and blessed with four children. Rosan's husband is an overseas Filipino worker. While her husband is working abroad, Rosan receives remittances from him. Some of her husband's salary was invested in her hog raising business. Sometimes their income is still insufficient to cover both her children's needs and her hogs' feed. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs. Rosan believes that by having this loan she can fully provide for her children and her hogs.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs.

loans.name: Desiree

texts.en:
Desiree works hard to support her family. She is married and has a  pig-raising business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed.

Desiree has been in this business for six years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Desiree would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed

loans.name: Aurella

texts.en:
Aurella is 45 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school, Aurella works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines. Aurella has been in this business for 5 years and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

In the future Aurella would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Marie Gracelle

texts.en:
Marie Gracelle is a 37 year old, single woman. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Marie Gracelle has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 1 year. Marie Gracelle requested a PHP 28,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, spices, etc.

Marie Gracelle would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, spices, etc. for food vending

loans.name: Norita

texts.en:
Norita is 41 years old and married with three children, who are in school. She works hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, egg, noodles, etc.

Norita has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Norita aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Nelia works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Nelia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional material for her business like fishing nets.

Nelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional material for her business like fishing nets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the repairing cost of her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity  and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over four years, she has operated an open air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Alma

texts.es:
Alma es de la ciudad de Itá, es huérfana de padre actualmente vive con su madre y sus hermanos.
Es profesora de danza y actualmente está trabajando en una empresa, además está cursando el 4to. año de ingeniería en Tecnología de Producción, con lo cual quiere mejorar sus conocimientos para ir creciendo.
Tiene como meta en recibirse en su carrera y poder progresar como persona y profesional. Pide este préstamo para poder comprar sus útiles para la universidad.
texts.en:
Alma is from the city of Ita. Her father is deceased and she currently lives with her mother and siblings.
She teaches dance and is currently working at a company. Additionally, she is in her fourth year of engineering studies in production technology; she wants to improve her knowledge to continue growing.
Her goal is to receive her engineering degree and to grow personally and professionally. She is requesting this loan to buy her university supplies.

loans.use: to buy university supplies.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces major challenges of seasonality and competition in her place of business. 

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with six children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity.

Mwanasha has operated a coconut business. She sells at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 51 years old and widowed with three children, one of whom is in school. She works hard to provide for her family.

Victoria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Victoria has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming rice and pig fattening.

Victoria aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Estrilla

texts.en:
Estrilla is 57 years old and married with eleven children, one of whom is in school. She works hard to provide for her family.

Estrilla runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Estrilla has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns an income from farming rice.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell

loans.name: Odmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Odmaa, 39 years old, lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been running a grocery store since 2003. Her husband renders taxi service to local people. Their eldest son studies at a university, while their other two children go to high school. 

Using her previous loan, she renovated her house, enabling her family to live in a comfortable and warm place while burning less coal for heating. She is now requesting a loan of 3,000 USD to buy foodstuffs in large amounts. During this period of time, demand for foodstuffs increases dramatically due to a national festival called White Moon, so it is important to stock up her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs in large amounts

loans.name: Mohirzhon

texts.en:
Mohirzhon was born in 1984. He is hardworking man. Mohirzhon is married and has three children. His children are non-adults. He is a very hardworking father for his children.

Mohirzhon has been busy with growing agriculture products. He mainly grows vegetables. He has been busy with this business for more than two years. He tries to develop his business.

Mohizhon is asking for a loan of 10,000 Somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for the new sowing season. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica desde hace 3 años a la venta de pupusas su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz, chicharrón, quesillo,  frijoles, etc. todo por mayor para poder seguir con su trabajo y poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Margarita is 40 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and their three children. For 3 years, she has been selling pupusas. Her business is located in her home, and she has many clients, especially her neighbors. With the earnings she obtains, she succeeds in paying for some of the household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy corn, pork rinds, tortillas with cheese filling, beans, etc. wholesale, so that she can continue with her work and can have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy corn, pork rinds, tortillas with cheese filling, beans, etc. wholesale.

loans.name: Nargiz

texts.en:
Nargis was born in 1989. She is divorced and has 2 children. Her children are little; they are 3 and 5 years old. Nargis is the only food provider in her family. Her living conditions are bad and so she organized a new business 5 months ago in order to earn a living.

Nargis has a shop where she sells flowers. She is going to increase her new business. With this aim in mind, she took part in a course, ‘To Get Ahead’, at a woman's organization and got her certificate. She is asking for a loan of 7000 TJS to buy flowers and to increase her working capital.

She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy flowers.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
Nasiba is a brave woman. She was born in 1985. She is living in a remote district. She is married. She has three children. Her husband is working abroad in the Russian Federation. Nasiba was taught to help elders from her childhood. She is hardworking, clever and a patience person. She likes to help others. 

She got experience, and decided to have her own lovely activity.  She has been doing a business for almost five years. She keeps honored cattle and sells them in the domestic market. She wants to improve their standard of living, and tries her best to have a successful business. 

She is planning to buy additional honored cattle to enlarge her business.

loans.use: to buy additional honored cattle

loans.name: Ma. Grecilda

texts.en:
Ma. Grecilda works hard to support her family. Ma. Grecilda is married, and she has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Ma. Grecilda has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Ma. Grecilda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Sophat's Group

texts.en: Sophat is a 34-year-old married father of one young child. He resides in the rural village of Ek Phnom district, Battambang province. Sophat has been a carpenter, selling wood furniture for 10 years. He can earn about $10 (USD) a day. Sophat has been with VisionFund for seven loans. He is applying for a loan of 1,800,000 KHR to buy two motors for cutting lumber. He believes that the motors will help his business run more efficiently.

loans.use: to buy two motors for cutting wood

loans.name: Muungano Self Help Group

texts.en:
Veronica, the lady raising her hand in the photo, is a member of Muungano Self Help Group. She is a married mother of five children.
Her economic activity is poultry keeping. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in March 2013 and has received training on enterprise management and financial planning. This training has equipped her with skills to help her run her business effectively. Veronica is requesting a loan to purchase quality chicken feed and also to buy more chickens. She believes this will increase her output, especially egg production, and thus boost her income. She will be able to improve the overall living standard of her family by providing quality food and medical care.
She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and she promises to make established payments.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed and poultry.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 59 years old, married and blessed with four children. Jane’s economic activity is maize and bean farming. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in  2013 and received training on enterprise development and financial planning which has equipped her with skills to effectively manage her enterprise. 
She is borrowing money from Kiva to purchase farm inputs such as pesticides and manure. She hopes the inputs will help boost her farming business with a bountiful harvest that will increase her income. She will then be able to support her family by providing basic needs such as food. 
Jane is very grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as pesticides and manure to help improve farming.
