loans.name: Mik's Group

texts.en: Mik is a villager from a small town in Sangke district, Battambang province. She is a mother of seven. Mik and her husband have been planting cassava for two years and they can save about $5 (USD) daily. Mik has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for eight loans. Now leading her group of three, she is seeking a loan of 1,600,000 KHR for her cassava plantation. She will use the loan to buy cassava stems for planting and to hire workers. She wishes to keep expanding her plantation.

loans.use: to buy cassava stems for planting and to hire workers

loans.name: Yoeurn

texts.en:
A Dambae district villager of Kampong Cham province, Yoeurn is a 57-year-old widow with eight children. Three of her children are living with her. Her primary source of income is from planting cassava for 39 years. She has been a member with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, once before. 

Now she is applying for a loan of 5,000,000 KHR to rent a piece of land for a cassava plantation and to buy cassava stems to plant. Her goal is to expand her cassava business, and to improve the family financial situation.

loans.use: to rent a piece of land and to buy cassava stems

loans.name: Phea's Group

texts.en:
A Sieam Bouk district villager of Steung Treng province, 32-year-old Phea is a mother and a wife. She has five young schoolchildren.

Her main sources of income are from her cassava and soybean plantations. She has been depending on the plantations for five years.

This is her second time being a member of VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Leading her group, Phea is seeking a loan of 1,600,000 KHR to buy fertilizer for her cassava and soybean plantations. She hopes that both plantations will be more productive than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

location.town: Steung Treng Province, Sieam Bouk District

loans.name: Michatha (B) Organic Farming And Environmental Shg Group

texts.en:
The featured person in the photo is Loice, a member of Michatha (B) Organic Farming and Environment SHG Group. She is 31 years old and a single mother of one child. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013.

She owns a cosmetic shop as her main business. She is grateful to Hand in Hand Eastern Africa’s training on enterprise and financial management that has enabled her manage the business well. She is borrowing from Kiva to add more stock of perfumes and body lotions to her shop. This will ensure she meets her customers' rising demand, and thus increase her income. This will assist her in catering to her family's needs, such as food and school fees for her child. 

She is grateful to Kiva and the lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy more stock of perfumes and body lotions for her cosmetics shop.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is 30 years old, married and blessed with six children, four in primary school and two preschoolers.
Norah grows cereals, specializing in maize and beans. Since 2011, she also has sold bananas in the local market. 
After joining Hand in Hand in Hand in 2013, she received training on business development skills. That enabled her to expand her farming by leasing an extra acre of land to grow more maize and beans to meet high demand.
Norah is borrowing money to purchase farm inputs such as seed and fertilizer. She looks forward to more income to pay for her family's needs.
 
Norah is very grateful to Kiva and Hand in Hand Eastern Africa and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seed to help improve her income.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is 41 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell.

Genara has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Elsie works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming rice.  Elsie is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like sugar, eggs, beans, and milk for her food-vending business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested this loan to further build her businesses.

Elsie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like sugar, eggs, beans, and milk.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en: Narine sends her thanks to Kiva lenders and Nor Horizon for her first loan she used to purchase a computer. Narine lives in Kapan city in the Syunik region and she continues both translating and teaching activities. She works as an English language translator at a private company and still has a group of pupils she helps prepare for entrance examinations through privately paid courses. She says she is happy with her occupation and she is so proud that all her pupils have achieved high scores in their entrance examinations; both in writing and speaking English. Narine wants to spend this Kiva loan on the purchase of new professional literature and special disks for her courses which she will use for developing her pupils' English speaking skills.

loans.use: to buy professional literature and special disks for her courses which she will use for developing her pupils' English speaking skills.

loans.name: Phoeun's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of Prey Chhor district in Kampong Cham province, Phoeun is a 45-year-old married woman with four children. Two of the children, who are secondary school students, are living with her and her husband. 

They have been doing rice farming for 27 years to finance the family. They manage to save 6 USD per day for future uses. This is her first time being a member with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. 

She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 KHR to buy potash for her rice field. She wishes to use the profit from the rice farming to buy a water pump for the rice field.

loans.use: to buy potash

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan, se dedica  al cultivo de granos básicos, a la crianza de ganado y pollos, vive con su madre de 64 años de edad, ya cuenta con muchos años de experiencia y lo práctica para subsistir con su familia, su negocio propio está funcionando desde hace cinco años.
El préstamo será de apoyo para comprar una porción de tierra y prepararla para sembrar maíz, fortalecerá el negocio para generar más ingresos y tener un patrimonio con el que tendrá un mejor futuro.
Sus sueños son pagar la deuda adquirida, construir su casa propia  a la par de la de su madre para estar al pendiente de ella y cuidarla.
texts.en: Juan makes a living through the cultivation of basic grains and raising cattle and chickens. He lives with his 64 year old mother. He's tallied many years of experience and applies his trade for his family's subsistence. He's been operating his own business since age five. The loan would support the purchase of a piece of land to prepare for planting corn, fortifying the business to increase earnings and have a patrimony that will lead to a better future. His dreams are to pay off acquired debts, and to build his own house by his mother's to look after her and take care of her.

loans.use: the purchase of a piece of land to prepare for planting corn, fortifying the business to increase earnings and have patrimony that will lead to a better future.

loans.name: Loeup's Group

texts.en:
Loeup is an elderly villager of Ek Phnom district, Battambang province. She has eleven children. Her husband has already passed away, and now she is living with one of her children.

She has been selling vegetables at the market for 25 years. Her daughter also helps with the family budget by being a teacher at a local public school.

Loeup has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, for seven times, including now. The previous loans have helped their living condition considerably. As the leader of her group, Loeup is seeking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR to buy vegetables to sell. She hopes that the new loan will further help improve their financial status.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Izamar Isabel

texts.es:
Cada vez son más los jóvenes que se inclinan por la tecnología médica, una de las ramas no muy demandas en Nicaragua. Sin embargo, existen personas como Izamar, interesadas en aportar desde esta área al cuido y tratamientos de las  enfermedades que se presentan en los hospitales. Ella es consciente lo trascendental de esta labor, pues si no existiera sería difícil poder diagnosticar los casos y seguramente la tasa de mortalidad aumentaría. 
Izamar solicita el crédito para pagar los últimos módulos de titulación que le permitirán graduarse sin ningún problema en unos cuantos meses. Dicho préstamo le será de mucha utilidad ya que al ser egresada de esta carrera, podrá iniciar su vida profesional y ayudará con los gastos del hogar. También, planea a mediano plazo poner un laboratorio y con esos ingresos ahorrar para la compara de su casa.
texts.en:
Every time, young people are more inclined toward medical technology—one of the branches that are not very demanded in Nicaragua. Nonetheless, there exist people like Izamar who are interested in contributing to this area to care for and treat the diseases that present in hospitals. She is aware of the importance of this work, since if it didn’t exist, it would be difficult to be able to diagnose the cases of the diseases, and surely the rate of death would increase.

Izamar requests a loan to pay the last of her tuition, which will enable her to graduate without a problem in a few months. This loan will be very useful, since by being a graduate in this field, she will be able to start her professional life and will help with the household expenses. Also, in middle-term, she plans to have a laboratory, and with these earnings, she will save to buy a house.

loans.use: to pay for the last of her tuition.

loans.name: Ry's Group

texts.en:
Forty-two-year-old Ry resides in a small rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district in the Kampong Cham province. She lives with her husband and four of her five children. She has been planting corn for 24 years to support the family, while her husband is a construction worker. They can save about 7 USD per day. 

A new member of Kiva's partner VisionFund, Ry, for her part, is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 KHR for her corn plantation. She will use the funds to buy fertilizer and corn seed. She believes that the profit from the sale of corn will provide her family with a better living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and corn seed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Abel

texts.es:
Abel, es casado y no tiene hijos dependientes, vive con su esposa, él es muy reconocido en la zona por su buen desempeño como comerciante y su honestidad, se dedica a la ganadería y a trabajar en el campo cultivando granos básicos, al inicio solo tenía una vaca y poco a poco ha ido mejorando su inventario, su padre le enseño a desarrollar dichas actividades, su horario es de ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, atiende solo su negocio y visita los tiangues de la zona para comercializar el ganado, también en su vivienda realiza ventas de ganado. 
Invertirá en la compra de una vaca, vitaminas y concentrado para alimentarla, espera obtener buenos resultados de la inversión y seguir vendiendo ganado para tener ingresos para subsistir con su familia.
Sus aspiraciones son ampliar su negocio, lograr mejorar la raza del ganado y cubrir con responsabilidad sus compromisos.
texts.en:
Abel is married and doesn’t have dependent children. He lives with his wife. He is very well known in the area for his good performance as a businessman and for his honesty. He is dedicated to livestock and to working on the farm growing basic grains. At the beginning, he only had one cow, and little by little, he has been improving his inventory. His father taught him to perform these activities. His work schedule is from 8:00am to 5:00pm. He takes care of his business by himself, and he visits the small markets in the area to sell his livestock. He also makes livestock sales in his home.

He will invest in the purchase of a cow, vitamins, and pellets for food. He hopes to get good results from this investment and to continue selling livestock to have income to survive with his family. 

His goals are to grow his business, to succeed in improving his livestock breed, and to responsibly cover his obligations.

loans.use: to buy a cow, vitamins and pellets for food. He hopes to get good results from this investment.

loans.name: Sam Ath

texts.en:
43-year-old Sam Ath is married and has four children. Together, they are living in Prey Prorsorb district of Kratie province. 

She has been a rice farmer for 25 years. In addition, she is a paid worker at some cassava plantation when she needs more money. She is able to earn 5 USD each day. 

This is her second time being a member with VisionFund Cambodia, Kiva’s partner. Sam Ath is applying for a loan of KHR 2,000,000 for her rice farming. It is to be used to buy fertilizer and rice seed. 

She wishes that the rice farm will be more productive, which will mean more income for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
The person in the photograph is Mary, married, and blessed with six children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2012, so as to get knowledge in business management, to improve her business.

Mary does poultry farming and vegetable farming. She is borrowing money to buy poultry feed to help improve her farming. She hopes this will help keep up with the increased demand for chicken and related products in her locality. 

She looks forward to improved income, which she will use to cater to her family's needs, such as food and clothing.

Mary is happy to have the financial support.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed that will help improve productivity.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Seng is from Dorng Tung district, Kampot province. She is a 45-year-old widow with three children who are her dependents. To support the family, she has been a rice farmer for 27 years, raising livestock for additional income. She manages to save $4 (USD) each day. Seng is seeking a loan for her daughter's higher education fee. The daughter is planning to study to become a midwife. She hopes that her children will have a bright future.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's higher education fee

loans.name: Ry's Group

texts.en: Ry is a resident of Steoung Sen district in Kampong Thom province. She is 43 years old and married with four children who are in school. She has been a teacher for 30 years and she also operates a small grocery shop at home. She manages to save $5 (USD) daily. Ry had never borrowed from VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, before. Now, with her group of five, she is applying for a 500,000 KHR loan to build a toilet for her house. She wishes to have a proper toilet to use in order to create a better and healthier living environment for her family.

loans.use: to build a toilet

loans.name: Malika

texts.en: Malika is a hard-working woman who was born in a remote district. She is married with one child. After getting married, she became a seamstress. She tried to help her husband with finances but the money she earned from sewing did not cover everyday expenses so she decided to start a retail business. She saved up money from sewing and used it for her new business. She bought jewelry, women's clothes and menswear to sell at a profit. Then she saved money to open a store selling goods. Her husband helps her with her business. She is planning to expand her business and buy a new collection of goods. Malika requested financial support to buy more goods. She is hoping for support from Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a new collection of goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a digger instead of renting one for his business

loans.name: Elianne

texts.en:
Elianne is a 31-year-old married mother of one child. She opened her own beauty salon in 2012, to support her husband in covering their family's needs. 

Elianne is a hardworking woman, well known in her region, with a good reputation and special talents. She puts so much effort into developing her business to satisfy her current customers and into developing her business in a well managed way to make sure that she can expand her offerings, increase her number of customers, and provide her child a brighter future.

Today, Elianne is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with special beauty products that are necessary for her business development and customer satisfaction. She hope that in the future she can move her business to a better location and increase her beauty services.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with special beauty products

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine is 38 years old. She lives in the city of Sevan in the Gegharkunik region. She graduated from a medical college of nursing, but she never worked in her specialty. Having married very early, she became engaged in farming and agriculture with her beloved husband. They have a son and a daughter, and both of them are school-aged. 

Lusine still runs the farm, but does it alone now since her husband is in Russian Federation where he works. Every month her husband transfers money to his family, while in Sevan, Lusine alone manages all the work about her farm. Lusine lives with her mother-in-law, who is retired. Her mother-in-law tries to help Lusien about the farm, as there is much work to do with the cattle on the farm (cows, calves, a heifer, pigs, sheep, and chickens) and also the large plot of land to manage it all in time. Lusine cultivates potato, cucumber, and tomato on her plot of land. From her farm, she sells milk, macun (a national dairy product), cheese, meat, eggs and the vegetables of her land. As she says, farming is her main source of income and it also always provides fresh and tasty food for her family.

As she surely decided to enlarge the quantity of her potato production, she is asking for this loan to buy a lot of potato seedlings for spring sowing. She also needs to buy fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy a lot of potato seedlings for spring sowing and to buy fodder for her farm cattle

loans.name: Sreymech's Group

texts.en:
Srey Mech is a resident living in a small village of Snoul district, Kratie province. She is a young mother of two children under the age of 6. 

To support the family, she has been planting cassava and her husband is a paid worker. They can earn around 7 USD a day. 

Srey Mech had not been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, before. This is her first time and she is applying for a 1,000,000 KHR loan to buy fertilizer and cassava stems for her plantation. 

She hopes that her family's financial situation will be better and that she can buy more land for growing cassava.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and cassava’s stems

loans.name: Phalla's Group

texts.en:
A villager of the Kratie province, 43-year-old Phalla is married with three children. They are still dependent on her. For 12 years, her main source of income has been from rice farming. She also manages a small grocery store at home. 

Phalla has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, one time before. Now she is leading her group of two and seeking a 3,600,000 KHR loan for the group. She plans to use her portion of the loan to buy a piece of land for farming, as well as to buy potash and rice seed to cultivate it. She anticipates that the rice farm will be fruitful.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land, potash and rice seed

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 35 years old, married and together with his spouse has been blessed with six children. He farms in Narok town. He has been in this business for eight years and it has been profitable. 

He plans to use this loan to buy animal medicine, fertilizer and cattle feed. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. 

This is his eighth loan term from VisionFund Kenya and he paid his previous loan successfully. His hopes for the future are to grow his business, be prosperous and be able to provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy animal medicine, fertilizer and cattle feed

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a 52-year-old married woman from Ormoc, Leyte. She earns a living through her hog raising business. Jesscia has been in this business for more than a year. This is the source of her income. 

Jessica is asking for a loan to buy piglets to raise, as well as animal feed and supplements. A loan will help her improve her hog raising business, thus augmenting her income and profit. In the future, Jessica hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise, as well as animal feed and supplements

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es:
Carlos, es un joven que pertenece a la fuerza armada del país, es soltero, de su padre aprendió a desarrollar actividades agrícolas como: crianza de ganado y cultivo d granos básicos, hoy en día lo desempeña solo y en su tiempo libre, es así como ayuda a sus padres para que tengan una vida más digna.
Utilizará el financiamiento para comprar abono, insecticidas, plaguicidas y para limpiar el terreno de la maleza, esta acción le permitirá tener todo listo para su próxima siembra, como resultado espera tener mayores ingresos para que su familia tenga una vida más confortable, no tiene riesgos de perdida en su cosecha,  ya que el cultivo lo hace de regadillo.
Carlos está esforzándose para salir adelante con su familia, continuar estudiando y ampliar los productos de su negocio.
texts.en:
Carlos belongs to the armed forces of his country. He is single, and he learnt about agriculture from his father. He learnt about: cattle raising and  cultivation of basic grains. Nowadays, he works by himself in his spare time. This is how he helps his parents to have a more decent life.

He'll use the loan to buy fertilizer, insecticide, pest-control substance, and to clean up the weeds. Doing this will allow him to have the soil ready for the next crop. 

He hopes to have a bigger income so his family can enjoy a more comfortable life. There is not a risk of losing the harvest because he uses an irrigation system.

Carlos is making an effort to move forward with his family, keep studying, and to increase the products in his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, pest-control substance, and to clean the weeds to prepare everything for the following sowing season.

loans.name: Elsea

texts.en:
Elsea is 64 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Elsea has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Veton

texts.en:
Veton is single and 22 years old. He lives with his brother and sister with their father, since his mother passed away. Veton is very hardworking and optimistic despite the fact that he has only 1 hand. He doesn't let this handicap interfere with his motivation and his determination and works with his father in a private company that makes doors and windows. 

He also helps his family raising and tending to the cows that they keep. Currently they have 2 cows, but Veton is requesting a loan in order to purchase another cow and to renovate the stable. He hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his farm and work solely in agriculture, which is his passion. He is very grateful and promises to pay on time.

loans.use: to purchase another cow and to renovate the stable

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman is from Meghri town where he lives with his mother, wife, and two children. 

Arman is specialized as a furniture maker. He rents a small workshop and makes different types of furniture, receiving orders from local people living in Meghri. 

He applied for this loan to purchase materials needed for furniture making. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for materials needed for furniture making

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruits to resell.

loans.name: La Solucion Group

texts.es:
El comité lleva por nombre “La Solucion”, ha sido creado para trabajar en equipo y dar soluciones a  problemas de cada una, es un grupo rural que se encuentra en crecimiento, donde cada una lucha por sus familias y seres queridos. Se encuentran en el tercer ciclo, actualmente con 17 integrantes, todas ellas son mujeres trabajadoras y humildes. 
Se destaca entre ellas la Sra. Dora, quien se dedica a la producción y la cría de animales, y  vende sus cultivos por la zona que ella misma ha plantado, es una mujer muy trabajadora que lucha por poder salir adelante.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar semillas y abonos de verduras, como lechugas y otros, de manera a poder continuar con las plantaciones que hace y seguir luchando por su familia.
texts.en:
The group is called "La Solución" (The Solution). Its members created it in order to work together as a team and find solutions to their individual problems. This is a rural group that is growing. Currently, it has 17 members, all of whom are hard-working and humble women who work hard for their families and their loved ones. 

The group is in its third loan cycle. 

One of its outstanding members is Dora. She makes a living breeding and rearing animals, and selling her crops around the area where she works. She is a very hard-working woman, who strives to get ahead.

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and inorganic fertilizer like lettuce, to be able to continue growing her crops and keep on working hard for her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and inorganic fertilizer to grow her crops.

loans.name: Jaime Abdier

texts.es: Don Jaime tiene más de 30 años de trabajar en el sector agropecuario. Heredó de sus padres una finca y aprendió de ellos la ganadería de ceba y la lechería. Junto a su esposa e hijos sigue promoviendo su pequeña empresa. Con esta actividad ha logrado que dos de sus hijos estudien en la universidad, mientras sigue criando junto a su esposa al más pequeño, de nueve años. Desea asegurar la salubridad de su ganado y de la producción de leche, así como disminuir el estrés que provoca en los animales el estar en un espacio tan estrecho. por ello necesita ampliar el corral y la galera en la que extrae la leche. Con un préstamo de $2,075 logra cubrir este proyecto. Sus objetivos son generar mayores ingresos con el incremento de la producción, mejorando así la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Jaime has worked in the agriculture and ranching sector for more than 30 years.  He inherited a farm from his parents and learned livestock fattening and dairy production from them.  He continues to promote his small business, with his wife and children.  With this job he has managed for two of his children to go to college while he and his wife continue to raise the youngest, age 9.

He wants to ensure the health standards of his livestock and his milk production as well as decrease the stress it causes the animals to be in such a narrow space.  That's why he needs to expand the corral and the galley for milking his cows.  He'll be able to cover this project with a loan for $2,075.

Jaime's goals are to earn more income with the increase in production, thus improving his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to expand the corral and the galley for milking the cows

loans.name: Aloe Cristine

texts.en:
Alo Cristine is 21 years old, married, and has two children. 

She has owned and managed a sari-sari store for six years already. She gets her living from her business. 

Alo Cristine became a member of Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2014 and decided to borrow a loan amounting to PHP 8,000 to purchase additional stocks for her sari-sari store and to increase her inventory to have more sales, so that she can earn more income. 

Alo Cristine's future plan is to expand her business to earn more income, to give her family better lives.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are going to school. She also takes care of additional family members. 

For the past 11 years, Madina has operated a retail shop in a rented shop. She operates her shop on both retail and wholesale bases. She works seven days a week.

She has requested a loan of 2,700,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy sugar, rice, soap, cooking oil, flour, peas,and beans. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations include buying a bigger fridge to stock more cold drinks. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, soap, cooking oil, flour, and peas

loans.name: Irene Joy

texts.en:
Irene Joy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling beauty products in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy beauty products to sell for her business buying and selling beauty products. Irene Joy has been in this business for 2 years, and she earns more income from food vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy beauty products to sell for her business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Margaret. She is fifty-three years old, married and blessed with six children.

She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from training in enterprise development and financial management. This has helped her improve her knowledge of business management.

She runs a kiosk selling foodstuffs such as flour, salt and sugar, and washing detergents. She is borrowing a loan to add more stock to her kiosk. This will improve her sales volume, thus more income in order to continue supporting her family by providing basic needs such as food and clothes.  

Margaret is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of food stuffs such as flour, salt and sugar, and washing detergents

loans.name: Alik

texts.en:
Alik is a taxi driver from Sisian town. Using his own car, Alik provides Sisian-to-Yerevan transit for local people. He is married with a little son. 

To be able to make an investment on the car and continue his taxi driving business, Alik has applied for this loan. He asks lenders' support to purchase four tires and renovate the engine.

He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for four tires and renovation of the engine

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena, de 36 años de edad, estudio la carrera de técnico en sistemas informáticos, está casada y su esposo es empleado en una empresa desde hace dos años, tiene tres hijos de las edades de 8, 6 y 3 años, de los cuales los dos mayores estudian en la escuela.

Magdalena, trabaja de secretaria en una cooperativa desde hace cinco años, gracias a su nivel de estudio le fue fácil poder encontrar este trabajo, el cual le ayuda a poder cubrir algunos de los gastos en su hogar.- María, trabaja de lunes a viernes de 7 de la mañana a 4 de la tarde, para desplazarse a su trabajo tiene que viajar en bus media hora.

El financiamiento del crédito lo necesita para comprar 200 bloques, 2 quintales de hierro, 8 bolsas de cemento y poder pagar mano de obra que construirá un muro de contención.

María, desea en un futuro poder mejorar su vivienda, para poder vivir cómodamente con su familia, también desea poder ayudar a sus hijos, para que estudien y puedan graduarse de una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Maria Magdalena, who is 36 years old, studied in a program in information systems technology. She is married and her husband has been employed in a business for two years. She has three children, ages 8, 6, and 3, of whom the two older ones are in school.

Maria Magdalena has worked as a secretary in a cooperative for five years. Thanks to her level of education, it was easy for her to find this work, which helps her to be able to cover some of the household expenses. Maria Magdalena works from Monday to Friday from 7 in the morning to 4 in the afternoon. To get to her work, she has to travel half an hour on a bus.

She needs the financing from the loan in order to buy 200 blocks, 2 quintals [about 200 lbs] of iron, and 8 bags of cement and to be able to pay for labor that will build a retaining wall.

In the future Maria Magdalena wants to be able to improve her house in order to be able to live comfortably with her family. She also wants to be able to help her children, so that they can go to school and graduate from university programs.

loans.use: to buy 200 blocks, 200 lbs of iron, and 8 bags of cement and to be able to pay for labor that will build a retaining wall at her house.

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
43-year-old Srey is living in a small rural village of Snoul district of Kratie province. She is married with three children and one of them is living with her. 

Her only source of income has been from planting cassava for 6 years. It can earn her roughly 10 USD a day and she is able to save 5 USD for future uses. 

Being with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) second time, Srey is a leader of her group and is applying for a loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. Her portion of the loan will be used to buy potash and cassava stems for her plantation. 

She hopes that the plantation will be more productive so that they can earn more profit.

loans.use: to buy potash and cassava stems

loans.name: Hean's Group

texts.en:
Hean is from the Keo Seima district of Mondulkiri province. 39 years of age, she is married with no children.

To earn a living, Hean has had a cassava plantation for 17 years. She manages to keep 7 USD for savings each day. Over this time, Hean has been a member with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, twice.

She is leading her group to apply for a 4,400,000 KHR loan. Her portion of the loan will be used to buy fertilizer and cassava stems for the plantation. She wishes for her family's financial situation to be improved and that they can find some happiness.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and cassava stems

loans.name: Berna

texts.en:
Berna has been engaged in a poultry farming business for the past 10 years. Her major business challenges include thieves, seasonality, and poultry diseases. She earns additional income from operating a retail shop. Berna has applied for a loan in the amount of 1,700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy chicks ,vaccines, feeding utensils, and poultry feed.

She and her husband have five children, four of whom are enrolled in school. The family resides in a rented house and has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and food for the family. Her goal is to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy chicks, vaccines, and poultry feed

loans.name: Holbibi

texts.en:
Holbibi is a generous woman. She was born in 1984. She is living in a rural area, and she is married with two children. She grew up in family of farmers. She was taught to work hard from her childhood. When she got married, her husband did not work. It was hard for them to meet the family's needs, and they were used to serious impediments. That is why Holbibi decided to help her husband. 

She worked at seasonal jobs from which she saved money. With those savings, she bought honored cattle. She started her own business selling milk. While making her business better, she also helped her family. Her business progressively succeeded. 

Now, she has enlarged her business and opened a store in her area. She is confident because she is constantly supported by her husband. Holbibi is a good example of behavior and an honest worker among her neighbors. She is asking for a 10,000 somoni (TJS) loan to improve her business. She wants to buy grocery products for her store.

loans.use: to buy grocery products

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
A resident of a rural village in the Borseth district of the Kampong Speu province, Yun is an elderly mother of five. Three of them are living with her and her husband. 

Yun has been a rice farmer for 42 years in order to support the family. This work provides her with 3 USD savings a day. 

This is her second time working with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Yun is seeking a loan for her son to study geography in university. She hopes that he can finish his studies and have a good future ahead.

loans.use: to sponsor her son to study in university

loans.name: Samalani Group

texts.en:
Joyce is 35 years old and married. She has five children and only two of her children go to school.  The other three do not go to school because she cannot afford to pay for their school fees as her wages are not enough.

Joyce owns a carpentry shop were she makes different kinds of materials such as tables and chairs, just to mention a few.  She wants to obtain another loan in order to buy more materials such as timber for her carpentry shop.

Purchasing these materials will help her to increase the commodities to be sold, and this will help her to also increase her profits. She plans on sending all her children to school and hopes to build a better house for her children.

loans.use: to buy timber

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Juvy works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling ginger in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. 

Juvy is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of ginger to sell for her business.

Juvy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of ginger to sell

loans.name: Gul

texts.ru:
Ее зовут Гул. Ей 51 год. Имя Гул обозначает цветок. Гул замужем и проживает на районе Сарбард вместе с семьей. У нее трое детей. Дети растут и растут их расходы. Одному мужу тяжело стало обеспечить детей, и Гул вышла на работу. Вот уже в течение 2 лет Гул на рынке занимается продажей хлебобулочных изделий. Ей нравиться ее работа. Гул на работу выходит в любую погоду и в будущем она надеется иметь помещение или палатку. 
  Причина обращения Гул за кредитом является покупка стройматериалов для ремонта дома. Она не имеет средств, чтобы завершить ремонт. Гул надеется, что ей не откажут в кредите, и она сможет в скором времени закончить ремонт дома.
texts.en:
This is Gul, whose name means "flower". She is 51 and married and lives in the Sarband region with her family. She has three growing children whose needs are growing, too. It was getting hard for her husband to provide for the children on his own, so Gul started to work as well. For the past two years she has been selling bread products at the local market, an occupation she enjoys. She goes to work in all weather and in the future hopes to have her own space or booth.

The reason Gul is looking for a loan is to purchase building materials to renovate her house. She doesn't have the money to finish the renovations. She hopes that she will receive this loan so she will be able to complete her renovations.

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Mpunga Group

texts.en: Zuhura is in her early 40s, married, and has one child. For the past eight years, she has been selling charcoal, samosas, and milk. She works from 6 AM to 8 PM daily and earns a stable monthly profit. This is Zuhura's second loan from Tujijenge. She used her past loan to purchase flour, oil and potatoes to make her samosas. She successfully paid back her first loan and used the profits to purchase household items, as well as a television and radio. Zuhura will use this loan to purchase charcoal to sell as well as more ingredients to make her samosas. Zuhara dreams of improving her business and building her own home. Zuhara will share this loan with her loan group, Mpunga, which consists of one other person. They will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal and ingredients for samosas

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is an energetic, ambitious 27-year-old married mother of one child, who started her own beauty business in 2007, competing today with nine years of experience in her domain.

Mona runs her business properly. She is a hairdresser and a makeup artist. She works hard to develop her family's living, that's why in addition to beauty services she provides, she also rents special occasion dresses, in which she is investing her current acquired Kiva's partner Al Majmoua Youth  Loan.

Her acquired Youth loan will be invested in developing her special occasion dresses renting sector with new released items that will attract customers' attention and increase her income.

She hopes that in the future, she will be financially capable of moving her business to a better location and attracting more customers.

loans.use: To develop her special occasion dresses renting sector with new released items that will attract customers' attention

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a chair for his barber shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 24-year-old single man from Jericho. He works in applying tiles in the construction workshops. He has been in this job for the past three years. It is a good business, and the income is high.

Imad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new tools for his construction business. This will help him to increase his productivity and also his income.

Imad appears in the photo while he was working.

loans.use: to buy new tools for his construction business.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. 

Eunice will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of fish. Her business goal is to have  a financially stable business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is married with six children; three attend school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. 

Aisha sells used clothes. She has applied for a loan of 900,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy bales of used clothes. She has been in this business for eight years and works in the market six days a week. She generates additional income from farming. Her major business challenges include the rainy season as customers can not always reach her. 

 Aisha aspires to buy land to expand her farming business. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of the low amount of interest charged. She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or running water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Damalie

texts.en:
Damalie lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children and both of them go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells secondhand clothes at the market on a retail basis. She works six days a week. She has been in this business for the last five years. Damalie gets additional income from poultry farming. 

She has requested a loan of 1,100,000 UGX from MCDT–SACCO to buy a bale of secondhand clothes. Her major challenges include transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children to the university level. She would like to build more rooms for her poultry business so as to diversify her income. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bale of secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 27 years old, married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with one child. He is in motorcycle transport. He has been in this business for four years and it has been profitable.

He plans to use this loan to buy spare wheels for the motorcycle. He will use the anticipated profits to plough back into his business.

This is his second loan term from VisionFund Kenya and he paid his previous loan successfully. His future hopes are to grow his business, be prosperous and be able to provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy spare wheels for the motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David used his previous loan to pay for labor for weeding his onion farm.

David has remained a farmer, growing bananas and at the same time has a retail shop. He is faced with the challenges of price fluctuation and weather changes that hinder the progress of his business. Besides that, he has hopes of educating his children to higher levels of learning.

David has asked for a loan to improve his banana plantation by mulching it.

loans.use: to improve his banana plantation by mulching it.

loans.name: Emine

texts.en:
Emine is married and has two children. She wanted to do something to support her husband and family and meet her children’s school needs. With her mother-in-law’s help she began selling Tupperware. Then she began buying and selling pans from a local factory. She began going to markets to increase her sales. She’ll use her second loan to buy pots and pans to sell. Because she makes half profits on these products, she wants to continue selling them. She wants to increase her income and have a better living standard.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

Emine Hanım evli, iki çocuk annesi. Eşine ,ailesine katkı sağlamak, çocuklarının okul ihtiyaçlarını sağlamak için bir şeyler yapmak istiyor. Kayınvalidesinin desteği ile Tupperware satmaya başlıyor. Daha sonraları mahallesinde tencere imalatı yapan bir fabrikadan tencereler alarak satmaya başlıyor. Daha çok satış yapabilmek için de pazarlara çıkmaya başlıyor. Aldığı ikinci kredi ile de tencere,tava alıp satacak. Bu işte yarı yarıya kar ettiği için, bu işine devam etmek istiyor. Gelirini arttırıp daha iyi bir yaşama kavuşmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy pots and pans

loans.name: Malisela

texts.en:
Malisela is a 21-year-old grovery store owner and Camfed Learner Guide. As a volunteer Learner Guide, she teaches life-skills to students in her ward’s secondary school, including lessons on effective communication and personal confidence. Malisela’s grocery store helps her generate income to provide vital support for her family. 

She is now requesting a Kiva loan in order to expand and diversify her business buy increasing products in her grocery and buy household expenses to her family. Larger profits from her grocery store would allow her to send her siblings to school. The interest on Malisela’s loan will be repaid through her weekly two and a half hours of volunteering, which are so valuable for Camfed’s work with younger students.

loans.use: to expand and diversify her business by increasing products in her grocery.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 24-year-old single man from a village near Nablus city. He is a father of one small son. Mohammad opened a barber shop recently and he is preparing it and buying all the needed tools. 

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a chair for his barber shop. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to start his job.
 
Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a chair for his barber shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase wood to meet her customers' demands

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en: Firuza is widowed and has three children. She was born in 1971. She is the main provider of her family and she works hard to earn a living. Firuza has been busy with animal husbandry. She mainly feeds cows. Now, she has two cows. She also has additional income from growing vegetables. She mainly grows tomatoes, cucumbers, radishes etc. Firuza is asking for a loan of 2,500 TJS to buy cattle and feed for cattle. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cattle and feed for cattle.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
It is common to have a chicken farm in Kenya, but starting your own business is something else entirely. Sally is a smallholder mixed farmer based in Nandi Hills, a remote village in Kenya. She is the mother of five lovely children and has been practicing mixed farming for the last two years.

To earn a decent living, she sells eggs, milk,tea and greens and engages in numerous small personal businesses, including transportation. Only recently, she started seeing how she could make more money through poultry farming. In the past, she saw raising hens as just a hobby. She wants to sell more eggs but realizes that the quantity she produces now will not make economic sense. She needs to purchase more poultry.

However, her biggest challenge today is limited funds to expand her business. Sally is seeking a loan of KES 20,000 from Kiva lenders, via Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase poultry. Future proceeds from the commercialization of her poultry farm are already committed to paying for her children's education. In the long run, she is confident that her efforts will translate into a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional poultry.

loans.name: , Felomina  .

texts.en: Felomina is 64 years old, married and has six children. She has managed her own sari-sari store business for six years with the help of her husband who is a fisherman for their source of living. She joined and became a member of GDMPC in 2008. Recently she borrowed a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store to increase her inventory to have more sales so that she can earn more income. Felomina's future plan is to expand her business so that she can have more income to provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace needs a loan to buy food to sell like Irish potatoes and sweet potatoes. She is a hardworking woman who sells fresh food in a market. She started the business to generate more income to support her family. She wishes to buy land for farming, but inadequate capital affects her business.

loans.use: to buy food to sell like Irish potatoes and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Paddy

texts.en: Paddy is a 27 year old married man with 1 child living in Fort Portal Uganda. He sells spare parts of motorcycle seats and covers, and at the same time owns a retail shop and sews clothes, which adds him more income. He faces challenges of limited capital, that hinder the progress of his business. Besides that, he hopes to make a workshop for his business. Paddy has asked for a loan to buy cement, bricks, sand and pay labor.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, sand and pay labor for construction.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the loan she is requesting of KES 50,000, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel is from Vanadzor town. He lives there with his parents, and together with his father is involved in construction. They provide different types of construction work to local people of Vanadzor town.

To be able to purchase cutting tools for tiles and make their work more effective, Samvel applied for this loan. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for cutting tool for tiles.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a butcher shop business for the past 10 years, selling goat meat. She faces a major challenge of ccompetition in her business.

With the loan of 30,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of goats for slaughter to get meat for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goats for slaughter to get meat for sale.

loans.name: Gnel

texts.en:
Gnel and his wife live in Vanadzor town. Their two sons live and work in Russia and support their parents financially time by time.
 
Gnel is a builder. He has been involved in construction work for 10 years, providing different varieties of interior design and cosmetic repairs to his customers. 

To be able to purchase tools needed for providing construction work, Gnel has applied for this loan. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for tools needed for providing  construction work

loans.name: Loyce

texts.en:
Loyce is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a butcher shop for the past two years, selling goat meat to the community. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business. With the loan of 30,000 KES that she is requesting, she wants to purchase goats for slaughtering to get meat for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats for slaughtering to get meat for sale

loans.name: Sasun

texts.en:
Sasun lives in Vanadzor town with his wife and two children. He has been providing construction work to local people in the Lori region for five years already. Sasun is the only breadwinner in his family, so he works hard to sustain their living.

To be able to purchase a tool needed for providing construction work (a rotary hammer drill), Sasun has applied for this loan. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a tool needed for providing construction work (a rotary hammer drill).

loans.name: Samnang's Group

texts.en:
Samnang’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Samnang raises cows, and he also does extra work as a farmer and farm laborer to support his family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this woman and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Khantouma

texts.en:
Khantouma runs a small general supply store at Bassa Community. She hopes selling SE4ALL products like 
CH-2300 clean cookstoves will be very profitable and add to her business success. The Kiva loan allows her 
to add this SE4ALL product to her inventory and make a profit, allowing her to easily repay the loan.

loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Lasha

texts.en: Lasha is 23 years old. He lives with his parents in Martvili district. Lasha is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has a pig. Lasha cultivates family-owned agricultural land and grows fruits and vegetables, which is sold locally. Lasha decided to expand his agribusiness and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 1,600 GEL. With the received credit, Lasha will purchase a cow and will start producing dairy products. This will increase his family income and with increased income, Lasha will expand the business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and start producing dairy products

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en:
Harutyun produces and sells souvenirs. He  specializes in watches, jewelry boxes, candleholders and other souvenir production and sales. Due to his unique and very beautiful production items, Harutyun's souvenirs are in high demand and he works hard to satisfy his customers. 

To be able to purchase raw materials (obsidian) for making souvenirs to sell, Harutyun has applied for this loan. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials (obsidian) for making souvenirs to sell.

loans.name: Lay's Group

texts.en: Lay’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Lay makes a living cultivating rice and finding fish to support her family. She has one young son in her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family.

loans.name: Sakor's Group

texts.en: Sakor’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sakor makes a living cultivating rice and finding fish and she also does extra work as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family.

loans.name: Rien's Group

texts.en: Rien’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Rien works as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family.

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian, 26 years old, is the mother of a 4-year-old girl and a 1-year-old boy. She lives in Katrahong, Johannesburg, with her mother and her 20-year-old sister. Lillian and her mother support the family by doing various types of piece jobs including laundry and house cleaning. Lillian is a good cook and she sometimes gets casual jobs to cook food for miners in food kiosks next to her home.

Lillian is looking for a loan to buy a stove, catering utensils, tables, chairs and a tent to start her own food kiosk. She will then be able to prepare food for her customers daily and earn a more stable income. There is a high demand for good quality food as the area is next to big mines. Lillian will use her profits to repay the loan and to help her sister go to college. Her vision is to open her own chain of restaurants.

loans.use: to buy a stove, catering utensils, tables, chairs and a tent to start her own food kiosk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Zelda

texts.en:
Zelda is 28 years old and the mother of one boy, age 3 years old. She lives in Hill brow, Johannesburg with her husband, her mother, and 2 sisters ages 14 and 16. Her husband has been the sole breadwinner in the family for a long time and Zelda's desire is to also earn an income so as to help her husband in meeting the family’s basic needs.

Zelda is a licensed motor vehicle driver and she sometimes runs errands for her friends and neighbors. Zelda is looking for a loan to enable her buy her own taxicab, which she will use to ferry customers around Johannesburg and also to continue running paid errands for her neighbors and friends.

Zelda has many friends and her neighborhood has a high population. This will ensure a good and continuous supply of customers, which will enable her repay the loan and support her husband in providing for the family.

loans.use: to buy a taxicab to start a cab transport business.

loans.name: Bentu

texts.en:
Bentu runs a rehabilitation center in Monrovia. She hopes selling SE4ALL products like clean cookstoves 
will contribute to the program success from profit made.	The Kiva loan allows her to obtain this SE4ALL products
and make a profit, allowing her to easily repay the loan.

loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Euvone

texts.en:
Euvone is a 23-year-old mother of 1 boy who is 2 years old. She lives in Malvern, Johannesburg with her twin sister. She is the sole breadwinner for the family. She earns a living doing contract jobs in local hair salons.

Euvone is a trained hair stylist and her excellent work has made her very popular with customers around Malvern. Euvone wants a loan to buy a hair drier, hair straighteners, blow dryers, diffusers, hair curlers, hot rollers, multi-styling kits and trimming scissors.

She will utilize the profits from the business to repay the loan and to expand her business as she prepares to take her child to school and her sister to collage.

loans.use: to buy a hair drier, hair straighteners, blow dryers, diffusers, hair curlers, hot rollers, multi-styling kits and trimming scissors

loans.name: Naaman

texts.en: This is Naaman, a farmer who grows maize, beans, carrots and cassava in small scale. He sells his produce in the local market to support his wife and children. He dreams to be a large scale farmer in his area. With the KIVA loan he will be able to increase his farm stock.

loans.use: to pay for farm stock

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Jeremiah. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013. He is forty-four years old, married and blessed with five children.

Jeremiah is a tailor, a business he has been doing for the last eight years. He appreciates Hand in Hand Eastern Africa’s training on enterprise development, for it has helped him diversify his enterprise from tailoring to selling ready-made clothes.

He is borrowing from Kiva in order to buy more clothes for resale. This will boost his income; hence, enable him to support and provide for his children's school fees and meet other family needs.

Jeremiah is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay his loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva lenders! Meet Florence, a 58-year-old, very hardworking, honest, and ever smiling mother of seven children. She lives with her husband in the lush Chuka Hills, in the central region of Kenya. 

Florence passionately loves farming. She has been farming for the past thirty years and has always managed to provide for her family. Feeding the large family she has, requires a lot of hard work and determination. Her other sources of income are milk, crops and some personal business that she does in order to provide food for her large family. In farming, she enjoys the returns she gets but is challenged to maintain a good standard of living. 

Florence has identified a free space on her farm and wants to fully utilize this space by keeping a good quality dairy cow. Dairy farming in Kenya is a very profitable venture and milk prices in the recent past have been going up, so Florence, being a visionary and entrepreneurial woman, wants to take full advantage of this. She has chosen the breed of cow that she will keep, and she learns that she will not only get milk from the cow but also manure and this will boost the fertility of her farm. Selling the milk will never be a problem because there is a ready market and she will also sell to big dairy processing firms. 

Florence said she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer agricultural-based loans, and their interest rate is low and on a reducing basis. She underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, and from the training she learned that saving is a continuous process in many micro finance institutions. 

Florence hopes that through the accumulated profit she will be able to start adding value to her milk by starting services such as packaging and the production of other dairy products. This loan will change her life and will secure the future of her seven school-going children. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en: Nasiba is a kind woman. She was born in 1968. Nasiba is married and has two children. Her children are adults. She lives with her family in a village. For more than 10 years, she has been busy with aviculture. She feeds chickens. Nasiba’s working day usually begins early in the morning. She has 400 chickens now. She sells eggs in a local market. Nasiba is going to increase the working capital of her business and in this way, improve her profit. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to buy chickens for increasing her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Aun

texts.en: Aun is a 58-year-old married rice farmer with a grown-up child. She lives in the Kampong Speu Province in Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice for over 14 years. Her husband is a 62-year-old farmer and her only child works as a security guard. Together, they can earn approximately USD 8 per day. Aun would like to request a loan to buy a motorcycle for her child to commute to work. This loan will help her child to reduce traveling expenses and have better traveling conditions. In the future, she hopes to expand her rice farm.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her child to commute to work

loans.name: Nona

texts.en:
Nona is a 49-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and son in Martvili district. The family is involved in the husbandry business. In particular, they have two cows, two pigs and a calf. Nona milks the cows every day and produces dairy products to sell locally. In addition, they have 50 nut trees and sell harvested nuts locally. As the income is only seasonal, Nona decided to start an additional business, which will be more stable.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 4000 GEL. With the received credit Nona will build a market and will also purchase all the stock to open a market. She will sell home products there and will be able to increase the family income.

loans.use: to open a market

loans.name: Sam Ol's Group

texts.en: Sam Ol’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sam Ol works as farmer and she also does extra work as a village coordinator to support the family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these men and woman to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family.

loans.name: Salim's Group

texts.en:
Salim’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia.  Salim works as farmer and she also does extra work as a farm labourer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel to boil water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Tevy's Group

texts.en:
Tevy’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Tevy makes a living cultivating corn and cassava to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel to boil water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the loan, she is requesting of Kes 50,000, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: No's Group

texts.en: No’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. No raises cows and she also does extra work as farmer and farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family.

loans.name: Chhuon's Group

texts.en: Chhuon’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Chhuon works as farmer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help both this woman and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family.

loans.name: Colinas Group

texts.es:
Está integrado por tres mujeres cordiales de la etnia miskita: Lesvia, Jacinta y Catrina, viven en Bilwi. Con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para accesar a préstamos en Pana Pana, se organizaron hace un año, para tener la oportunidad de mejorar sus pequeños negocios de venta de ropa usada, venta de bastimentos y pulpería, aumentar sus ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Están solicitando su segundo préstamo con Kiva. Con el primer préstamo Jacinta integrante del grupo solidario logro comprar más productos de uso del hogar, Lesbia coordinadora del grupo solidario surtió de mariscos y pescados y los vendió a precios accesibles a su clientela de Bilwi y mando a comprar a Managua productos de bellezas y cosméticos con las ganancias percibidas.

Catrina: Es integrante del grupo solidario, casada con 5 hijos: 4 adolescentes que estudian su primaria y secundaria y un pequeño de 9 meses. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal como albañil. Desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de bastimentos, verduras y frutas que vende en las paradas de buses de Bilwi de lunes a sábado es su jornada de trabajo, de esta manera contribuye con los gastos del hogar y en los estudios de sus hijos. Solicita financiamiento para surtir de negocios de bastimentos, verduras y futas. Ella y su esposo sueñan con establecer en su vivienda una pulpería.
texts.en:
This group is composed of three cordial women of "Miskita" ethnicity. Lesvia, Jacinta, and Catrina live in Bilwi. They organized a year ago to work together and access group loans in Pana Pana. This has given them the opportunity to improve their small businesses of selling used clothing, selling supplies and groceries, and thus increasing their incomes and improve the quality of life for their families. They are requesting their second loan with Kiva. With the first loan, member Jacinta purchased more household products. Lesbia, coordinator of the group, purchased seafood and sold them at affordable prices to her customers in Bilwi and additionally, purchased beauty and cosmetic products and sold them to earn profits.

Catrina is a member of the group. She is married with five children: four who study in primary and secondary school and also a young 9 month old. Her husband works informally as a bricklayer. For 8 years she has made a living selling supplies, vegetables, and fruits at bus stops in Bilwi from Monday to Saturday. In this way, she contributes to household expenses and her children's studies. She is asking for financing to stock up her business with supplies, vegetables, and fruits. Catrina and her husband dream of establishing a grocery store in their home.

loans.use: to stock up her business with supplies, vegetables, and fruits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.
