loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for his work.

loans.name: Roline

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva Lenders! Meet Roline from Chuka Kenya, a woman from a community not known for farming but who is earning a living through agriculture. She is happily married and together with her husband is blessed with three lovely children. For the past 20 years, she has been practicing mixed farming, and, because of the experience she has, she commands a lot of respect from fellow farmers and she is regarded as a mentor. Income from milk, eggs, and maize selling have allowed her to earn a decent income. To make the extra coin, Roline engages in small personal business. Roline passionately loves dairy farming and the animal on her farm has been given the name of “Kairo.” Milking and feeding Kairo (the name of her cow) makes her very proud.

Through milk selling, she has had quite good returns and the demand for milk has been expanding. Through extensive use of her mobile phone, she has been receiving orders from customers. Then she can SMS her customers when milk is ready for collection, and because of using ICT she has had a comparative edge in her dairy business.

Demand has been overwhelming and she needs an extra breed of cow to satisfy fully the demand. She is requesting a loan to buy a quality dairy cow. Roline does not intend to buy just an ordinary cow but she wants to buy a distinct breed that is easy to manage and has a natural ability to produce rich creamy milk. The dairy cow will be producing between 15-20 litres of milk a day. The increased milk production will translate to more income and Roline will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her school going children. When anybody listens to Roline speak, one would be forgiven for thinking that she is an expert in dairy farming but because of passion and determination she intends to beat all odds. This loan will permanently change the living standards of Roline and there is no doubt that you can find rewarding employment in dairy farming.

loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Magret

texts.en: Magret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom go to school. She has no additional family members that she cares for. She operates a pharmacy in a shop that she rents. She has been in this business for the last 13 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 1,100,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy syrups, vaccines, and other drugs. Her major challenge is patients that buy from her shop and default on their payments. Her goal is to educate her children to university level. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy drugs, syrups, and vaccines

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлуда женщина в возрасте 49 лет, она замужем и имеет 3-х детей. Мавлуда проживает в сельской местности и занимается вышиванием национальных платьев. Этой профессией она начала заниматься с юности, так как ее мама тоже была швеёй она и привила ей любовь к вышиванию. Муж и младший сын работают в России частными рабочими на стройке и каждый месяц отправляют ей деньги. Эти деньги она использует на строительство и ремонт дома. У Мавлуды сейчас дела идут очень хорошо, но муж и сын на данный момент не могут отправлять ей деньги из-за политических ситуаций в России и ей приходиться рассчитывать на себя, чтобы доделать ремонт в доме. Тех денег, что она зарабатывает не хватает и она решила обратиться в МДО "АРВАНД" за финансовой поддержкой. На полученные деньги она хочет закончить ремонт. Мавлуда заранее благодарна за предоставление кредитов малоимущим сельским жителям.
texts.en: Mavluda is a 49-year-old woman who is married and has three children. She lives in a rural area and sews traditional dresses. She started sewing as a child because her mother was a seamstress and taught her to love sewing. Her husband and youngest son are construction workers in Russia and send her money every month, which she uses to renovate and repair the house. Right now business is good for Mavluda, but her husband and son cannot send any money home because of the political situation in Russia. She has had to rely on her own income to finish the repairs on the house. She does not earn enough money, so she decided to apply for financial support with MDO Arvand. She wants to use the loan she receives to finish the repairs. Mavluda is grateful for loans made to low-income rural residents.

loans.use: renovate her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.use: to pay for one dairy Cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a clean cookstove.

loans.name: Ayaoavi

texts.fr: Ayaoavi âgée de 30ans est une femme mariée qui vit à Adamavo avec ses trois enfants. Pour venir en aide aux besoins de sa famille elle a pour activité la vente des bassines en alluminium et des boites de lait en se déplaçant dans le quartier et au marché. Ayaoavi s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé.  Ayaoavi sollicite ce crédit pour acheter les bassines de grandes tailles pour diversifier son commerce et réaliser encore plus de bénéfice afin de favoriser l'éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Ayaoavi, 30 years old, is a married woman who lives in Adamavo with her three children. In order to help her family's needs she has a business of selling aluminum bowls and tins of milk by moving around the neighborhood and market. Ayaoavi stocks up four times a month at the large market in Lomé. Ayaovi is requesting this loan to purchase larger bowls to diversify her business. She hopes to achieve more success to promote the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy 5 sets of bowls and 4 tins of milk

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a clean cookstove.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a clean cookstove.

loans.name: Asilbek

texts.ru:
Асилбек житель района Шахристон. Ему 26 лет. Асилбек недавно стал отцом. У него девочка. Ей сейчас почти 4 месяца. Для него рождения ребенка стал самым незабываем событием в его жизни. Его жизнь изменилась, и все что в дальнейшем он будет делать только во благо семьи. У него большая семья, кроме жены и дочки с ними живут его брат с женой и двумя детьми. 
  Асилбек занимается изготовлением деревянных окон. Так как его семья увеличилась и на обеспечения ребенка уходит много средств Асилбек старается работать больше, чтобы приносить в дом больше дохода. С такими намерениями он обратился за кредитом. Асилбек на заёмные средства приобретет древесину.
texts.en:
Asilbek is a resident of the Shahriston district. He is 26 years old. Asilbek recently became a father. He has a daughter, who is now almost 4 months old. The day of his child's birth became the most memorable event in his life. His life has changed, and he will do everything in the future only for his family's welfare.

Asilbek is involved in making wood windows. Because his family has grown, and a lot of money is going toward providing for the child, Asilbek tries to work more in order to bring more income home. He requested a loan with these intentions. Asilbek will use this loan to buy wood.

loans.use: to buy wood for making wood windows

loans.name: Al Zahrae 4 Group

texts.en:
Fatimah is the featured borrower of Al Zahrae 4 group which consists of three committed ladies, who decided to hold hands and stand up together with their acquired loan, and to make sure they can develop their businesses and family's living.

Fatimah is a 51-year-old single lady, who runs her business selling used clothes from her house, because she lives alone and can provide her customers the requested privacy. She started her current business in May 2011, and she is doing just fine. Her acquired loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, will help her increase her business merchandise with special winter and spring collections, in addition to home products that will increase her business income.

Fatimah is the lady at the center of the picture. As for the other group members, Fatima is the first from the right. She is 28 and single, she works as an accountant, and is the sole breadwinner to eight members of her family. Her requested loan will be used to cover certain unexpected family needs.  While Linda, is the lady at the far left side of the picture. She is a 30-year-old married mother of two children, who is going to increase her business merchandise with special bedding and an accessories collection.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special winter and spring collections, in addition to home products that will increase her business income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en: Zaituni lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, three of whom go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She sells fruits and vegetables at the market on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last eight years. She earns additional income from selling charcoal. She has requested a loan of 1,600,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of pineapples, onions, tomatoes and cabbages. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy land to start farming to reduce the costs of buying fruits. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and running water. Her monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy pineapples, onions, tomatoes and cabbages.

loans.name: Kulusumu

texts.en: Kulusumu is married with six children and three go to school. She has additional family members. She sells charcoal at the market and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. She sells on a retail basis seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. Kulusumu is aspiring to educate her children to university level. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of timely loans. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Santiago Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario Santiago lo integran tres mujeres emprendedoras que solicitan el financiamiento para sus negocios por primera vez en ADIM, lo coordina Ericka una joven con espíritu de superación propietaria de una fotocopiadora, este negocio lo tiene ubicado en su domicilio, el estar soltera le permite dedicarle más tiempo a su negocio, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de toner, hojas tamaño legal y tamaño carta, ya que estos son los productos más utilizados en este negocio, una de sus metas es comprar más maquinaria para crecer en su negocio. El resto de las integrantes son la señora Martha de 52 años de edad quien comercializa refrescos naturales y golosinas en su domicilio, y la joven Leonor de 19 años propietaria de una pulpería desde hace tres años.
texts.en:
Three enterprising women belong to the Santiago solidarity group. They are applying to ADIM for the first time for a loan for their businesses.

Ericka, a young woman with a spirit of achievement, coordinates the group. She is the owner of a photocopier. She has this business in her home. Being single allows her to devote more time to her business. She is applying for the loan to buy toner, legal-size paper, and letter-size paper, since these are the products she uses the most in this business. One of her goals is to buy more machines in order to grow her business.

The rest of the members are Martha, 52 years of age, who sells natural fruit drinks and snacks from her home, and the young lady, Leonor, 19 years old and owner of a small convenience store for the past three years.

loans.use: to buy toner, legal-size paper, and letter-size paper.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed with four children, all of whom attend school. She is looking after her siblings. 

Teopista lives in her own house without access to either electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food. She works six days a week. 

Teopista has been selling second-hand clothes from home, at retail, for the last 11 years. She also sews and repairs clothes to earn extra income. 

Teopista has requested a loan of UGX 500,000 from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy a bale of used clothes to sell. 

Her challenges include seasonality. Her dream is to see her business expand to selling different kinds of used clothes.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Tufahon

texts.en: Tufahon is a brave woman. She was born in 1977. She is living in remote district. She is married. She has two children. Her husband works at a government agency. For more than five years, Tufahon has had a business near a secondary school. She has a small store where she is selling products like nuts, pastries, biscuits, bread, lollipops, and labels. She had a renovation of her house, but some renovations are missing. She wants to complete the renovation. She needs to buy cement, calcimine, sand, etc. Tufahon is asking for financial support from Kiva to buy those necessary items for completing her house.

loans.use: to buy cement, calcimine, sand, etc.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en: Prossy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children who all go to school. She takes care of two additional family members. She sells secondhand clothes on a retail basis. She moves door to door to sell her products. She works six days a week. She has been in this business for the last seven years. She has requested a loan of 1,100,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to put up a permanent business premise. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: This is Amina who is married with three children. She does irish potatoe farming plus operate a hair salon. She has been farming potatoes for three years now. She sells her produce at the local market and she with the produce she takes cares of her family and educate her children. Her dream is to be a great supplier in her county and teach other farmer who to do smart agriculture. With a KIVA loan she intends to buy water storage items and farm inputs.

loans.use: to pay for water storage items and farm supplies

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the 50,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors waiting too long to repay for goods taken on credit.

With the loan of 50,000 KES she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Hearm's Group

texts.en: Hearm’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Hearm makes a living cultivating rice and cassava to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Han's Group

texts.en: Han’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Han makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a farmer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Blessing Group

texts.en:
This group is called Blessing. It consists of four women. They all live in traditional and simple families in Teshie, Accra. They know one another through friendship and neighborhood connections. They have applied for a loan of 2,700 Ghana Cedi (GHS) from Kiva through ID Ghana. They sell fish, doughnuts, groceries and secondhand clothing. 

Hannah is a 52-year-old married woman with two children. She is the featured borrower of the group. Hannah lives with her family in a rented apartment. She attended elementary school but could not complete her studies because she got married very young. She is a very dynamic and vigorous woman. 

Hannah has to help her husband in taking care of the family. As a result, she is requesting a loan of 700 GHS from ID Ghana. She will use the loan to purchase fish to smoke and sell at the market to her customers. 

Hannah hopes to expand her business to expand her customer base a few years from now with the help of Kiva through ID Ghana.

loans.use: To purchase fish to smoke and sell at the market to her customers.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen and his family happily live in Kapan City, which is in Syunik region. He has been a farmer since 2005. Before he used to run a small business of souvenir sales in a rented stall. He also has a specialty of baker, but never managed to work at it. After getting married, agricultural activities became his main occupation. On his plot of land he has established a nice orchard and a rich vegetable garden; he raises potatoes, beans, carrots and greens. His orchard is full with apple, cherry, mulberry, plum and peach trees. 

He sells all of his land’s harvest on his own truck, driving it along the city.  In the many parts of which, he has managed to have regular customers who even give him orders of this or that product. As Karen says he is happy that his farm’s harvest covers at least his family’s minimum needs. With this Kiva loan Karen wants to buy potato seedlings, lairs and also to use some of the money for repairing his truck.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings, lairs and also to use part of the money to repair his truck.

loans.name: Sayligul

texts.ru: Эту добрую, милую женщину зовут Сайлигул. Она замужем имеет четверых детей. Ей 51 год. Сайлигул имеет большую семью, состоящая из мужа, двоих сыновей, двоих дочек и невестки. Сайлигул дома предоставляет услуги портнихи. В основном ей заказывают национальную женскую одежду. Сайлигул профи своего дела. Причина ее обращения за кредитом заключается в том, чтобы купить новую швейную машинку. Она хочет купить вот эту швейную машинку, которую Вы видите на фотографии. Эта машинка ее мечты, действительно Сайлигул достойна, чтобы ее приобрести. Вы можете помочь Сайлигулу в этот момент.
texts.en: The name of this kind and cute woman is Sayligul. She is married and has four children. She is 51 years old. Sayligul has a large family, consisting of her husband, two sons, two daughters and a daughter-in-law. Sayligul provides seamstress services at home. She primarily receives orders for women's national clothing. Sayligul is an expert in her business. The reason for her loan request is a purchase of a new sewing machine. She wants to purchase this particular sewing machine that you see on the photograph. This is her dream machine, and Sayligul certainly deserves to buy it. You can help Sayligul at this moment.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married and has two children, both of whom go to school. She has a business selling used clothes at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for 12 years. She doesn’t have any other income generating activities. She works seven days a week. 

Margaret has applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more blouses, skirts, and shirts. Her major business challenges include thieves and defaulters. She aspires to buy a plot of land and build. Margaret resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more blouses, skirts, and shirts.

loans.name: Nuraim

texts.ru: Нураим, 44 года, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее, работает в детском саду, с 2000 года занимается сельским хозяйством- животноводством и полеводством. Супруг и дети Нураим помогают по хозяйству. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве есть корова. На арендованном участке мерою 0,60 Га и собственном в 0,45 Га Нураим выращивает картофель, кукурузу и хлопок для реализации. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян картофеля и помидоров, а также удобрений для обработки почвы и выращивания экологически чистых продуктов. Доходы от кредита Нураим планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и хочет построить во дворе теплицу.
texts.en: Nuraim is 44 years old, married and has 4 children. She has a secondary education and works at a kindergarten. She has also been involved in agriculture - animal husbandry and farming - since 2000. Nuraim's husband and children help her with the business. Today she has one cow on her farm. Nuraim grows potatoes, corn and cotton for sale on 0.60 hectares of leased and 0.45 hectares of owned land. She requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy potato and tomato seeds, and also fertilizers for treating the soil and growing ecologically clean products. Nuraim plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business and wants to build a greenhouse in her yard.

loans.use: to buy potato and tomato seeds, and also fertilizers for treating the soil and growing ecologically clean products

loans.name: Parveen Akhtar

texts.en:
Parveen Akhtar is 60 years old and residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of two daughters and one son and her husband has been doing his own business of cattle farming for the past six years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family and to manage the household. Her husband wants to purchase the animals for his business purposes, but due to financial constraints he is unable to purchase these cattle.

Therefore Parveen Akhtar has requested a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy these cattle to fulfill the needs of his business. This will also be good for him to earn a maximum profitable income derived from his business.

loans.use: to help her husband to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 6 children and two go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She operates a retail shop in a shop that she rents. She has been in this business for the last 6 years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested for a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy sugar, rice, soap, cooking oil, flour. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children to university level and buy a van to transport her merchandise. 

She lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, soap, cooking oil, flour.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Banco Mujer Emprendedoras
Fray Casiano, Puntarenas
	Banco Mujer Emprendedoras presenta la solicitud de crédito, por cuarta oportunidad, está conformado por 3 mujeres,  quienes han trabajado desde hace 8 años como grupo organizado en Fray Casiano, zona  de alta pobreza en Puntarenas, Región del Pacífico Central de Costa Rica. Han  demostrado buen manejo de los conceptos de trabajo grupal (solidaridad, ahorro; además de coordinan actividades generando fondos para ellas),  tiene reglas claras de trabajo. Han solicitado préstamos y conocen la modalidad de trabajo grupal.  Se forma la Junta Directiva y se levanta el acta No.4 para la solicitud de este préstamo.
 Su trabajo y  esfuerzo les ha permitido tener la actividad de comercio ambulante  mejor consolidada, situación que se corrobora en la visita realizada a cada una de las solicitantes. 

Yesenia, integrante del grupo, invertirán su crédito  en la compra de sandalias, ropa, artículos de belleza y mercadería en general, incrementando su inventario  y cubriendo pedidos para la época de verano en la zona de Puntarenas, que es una de las mejores temporadas del año para el comercio,  siendo una gran oportunidad para las ventas; es una  mujer muy luchadora y gracias a la organización interna del grupo logra realizar  la recuperación de la cuota en forma semanal,  lo que les permite tener un margen más amplio para la obtención del dinero para el pago. Ella es la presidenta, la  consideran una buena líder  y   espera contar con esté préstamo para seguir creciendo cada día.
Además el grupo realiza actividades  ofreciendo comida y rifas que les permiten incrementar su ahorro y apoyar a sus familia en los gastos del hogar y estudio de los hijos, ya que la mayoría de las integrantes son madres solteras y jefas de hogar y su aporte económico es muy importante para la calidad de vida de ellas y la de sus hijos e hijas. 
	Son mujeres luchadoras, que por medio de la organización han logrado superarse y mejorar los ingresos de sus familias, apoyando  el estudio a sus hijos y a sus parejas contribuyendo  en la economía familiar, ellas han logrado hacerse sentir en la zona donde residen, son conocidas por sus actividades de fin de semana, donde vende comidas en la comunidad dando trabajo a otras personas (familiares principalmente)para la elaboración de estos platillos, típicos de la zona costera costarricense, como vigorón, frito, ceviche y los tamales comida típica costarricense.
texts.en:
Banco Mujer Emprendedoras 
Fray Casiano, Puntarenas

The Mujer Emprendedoras communal bank is requesting its fourth loan. This group consists of three women, who have worked for eight years as an organized group in Fray Casiano—a high-poverty area in Puntarenas, in the Central Pacific region of Costa Rica.

The members have shown a good understanding of group work concepts, solidarity, and saving; moreover, they coordinate activities to earn money, and they have clear work rules. They have requested loans and understand the group work modality. The board of directors was formed, and the document number 4 for this loan application was drafted. 

Their hard work and efforts have allowed them to better consolidate their street trading businesses, a fact that has been corroborated during a visit with each one of the members.

Yesenia is a member of the group and will invest her loan in the purchase of sandals, clothes, beauty products, and general merchandise in order to increase her inventory and fulfill orders in the area of Puntarenas during the summer season, which is one of the best seasons for trade and, thus, a great opportunity for sales.

Yesenia is a very hard-working woman, and thanks to the group's internal organization, she manages to make the weekly repayments, which allows them more leeway to obtain the money to repay the loan. She is the chair of the group and is regarded as a good leader. She hopes to be granted this loan to keep on growing each day.

In addition, the members sell food and organize raffles—activities that allow them to increase their savings and help their families with the household expenses and their children's education. Since the majority of the members are single mothers and heads of their households, their income is very important for the quality of life and that of their children. 

They are hard-working women, who have managed to succeed and improve their families' income through the organization. By supporting their children's education and helping out their partners with the household expenses, these women have managed to make their presence felt in the area where they live.

They are known for selling food in the community on weekends. They employ other people (mainly relatives) to prepare the food—traditional dishes of the Costa Rican coastal zone such as "vigorón" (boiled cassava mixed with pork rinds and covered with a spicy cabbage salad), "frito" (pig soup), ceviche (marinated raw fish or seafood), and tamales.

loans.use: to buy clothes and merchandise to sell in the summer season.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has sold fruit drinks, milk, toothpaste, corn beef, banku and stew for 11 years now, in a kiosk at her residence. She has completed elementary school so she can read and write, which has helped her a lot in her business dealings with customers. Mary is 44 years old and enjoys selling because it has helped her come into contact with different characters, especially at the market. 

She is requesting a loan amount of GHS 1,400 to buy fruit drinks, milk, toothpaste, corn beef, corn and cassava dough to prepare banku, and stew to sell to customers. She will use the profits to increase a savings and expand her work.

loans.use: to buy fruit drinks, milk, toothpaste, corn beef, corn and cassava dough to prepare banku and stew to sell to customers.

loans.name: Saima Bibi

texts.en:
Saima Bibi is a 26-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three sons. 

Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly. Because of that, he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. 

Therefore, Saima Bibi has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw.

loans.use: cover the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Aziz-Un-Nisa

texts.en:
Aziz-Un-Nisa is a responsible mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a carry daba for twenty five years. He is responsible for providing for the needs of entire family. Her husband needs to carry out maintenance on his carry daba because the current condition of his carry daba is not good; it requires more maintenance on a daily basis. 

Due to insufficient financial means he is unable to do maintenance on his carry daba. Therefore Aziz-Un-Nisa has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Aziz-Un-Nisa's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. And then he can provide the better transport facilities to earn the profitable income. Aziz-Un-Nisa  also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Aziz-Un-Nisa is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's carry daba.

loans.name: Khadija Bibi

texts.en:
Khadija Bibi is a 34-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of 3 children. Her husband has been running a general store for the past nine years, he is alone responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family. 

Khadija Bibi's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities e.g rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business purposes. But due to financial constraints he is not in suitable position to buy all above these products for reselling purposes. Therefore Khadija Bibi has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and also be helpful for him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his household and business. 

Khadija Bibi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase commodities for her husband's business.

loans.name: In God Group

texts.en:
John is the gentleman standing on the right in the photo. He is 40 years old, married and has three children. John is part of the group called In God and with one other colleague, they are requesting a total loan amount of GHS 2,600 for their businesses which are to sell second hand clothing, drinks, frozen food, 'chop bar'. 

John is involved in second hand clothing and has been doing this business for one year now at the market. John is in the third loan cycle with ‘In God’ and has had successful previous loan cycles. His group meet every Monday where they make loan repayments, do savings and receive training on either business or health. 

He is staying in a family house and had formal education and can read and write very well. He will use his share of the loan to buy more lady's wear and trousers to sell at the market to his customers so that he will make more profit.

loans.use: To buy more lady's wear and trousers.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 22-year-old single lady, the sole breadwinner to three other members of her family, who opened nine months ago her current beauty salon and is working hard on developing it as much as she can to make sure she can reply to her customers' needs.

Sarah has four years of experience in this domain, and she is working hard on developing her talents as much as she can. Today, she is acquiring her third loan cycle from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, her Youth loan will be invested in increasing her business merchandise with special winter, spring and summer beauty products.

Her previous acquired loans helped her a lot in establishing her current beauty salon, and she is very proud with what she achieved until today.

She hopes to stay capable of developing her business in a well-manged way.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with special winter, spring and summer beauty products.

loans.name: Rawhi

texts.en:
Rawhi is a 21-year-old single man from Nablus city. He works as an employee in a local company. He also has a small grocery store where he sells basic products to the neighborhood. It is a good business and provides a good income. 

Rawhi took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products for his store to resell. This will increase the sales and also the income. 

Rawhi appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more products for his store to resell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 30-year-old, single man from Rafah city. He is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. Mohammad also has an educational center where he gives lessons to the school students. It is a good business and the demand is high.

Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his business. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to organize the student files and also download educational materials. Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his educational center.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 35-year-old married man from Ramallah city. He is a father of three sons. Mahmoud opened an aluminum workshop where he makes windows and doors. It is a good business and provides him with a good income.

Mahmoud took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy raw materials for his aluminum workshop. This will increase his productivity and also his income.

Mahmoud appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for his aluminum workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more computers for his internet cafe.

loans.name: Ruksana Begum

texts.en:
Ruksana Begum is a 37-year-old lady, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of one daughter and two sons and her husband has been doing his own business of cattle farming for the past eight years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family and managing the house hold.

Ruksana Begum's husband wants to purchase animals for his business purpose but due to financial constraints he is unable to purchase these cattle.

Therefore Ruksana Begum has requested for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy these cattle to fulfill the needs of his business, this will also help him to earn maximum profitable income derived from his business.

For this financial assistance Ruksana Begum is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's cattle business.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: A 50-year-old Margret, is married and living in Hoima, Uganda. She deals in produce, mainly maize, rice, and beans among other items. She supplements her income by growing crops. She desires to educate her children and also to expand her business to a level of supplying her customers throughout the year. However, Margret's main challenge is inadequate capital. She will use the loan facility to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Francisca Florinda

texts.es:
Francisca, de 42 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está casada y su esposo es empleado, tiene dos hijos en la universidad que aún viven con ella y dependen económicamente de ella.

Francisca, vende productos de belleza por catálogo.

Francisca, está construyendo un cuarto para su hijo y necesita el préstamo para comprar bloque y cemento. 

Ella sueña con ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales.
texts.en:
Francisca, 42 years old, studied up to High School, is married and her husband is employed. She has two children attending University that still live with her and depend on her economically.

Francisca sells beauty products by catalog. She is building a room for her son and needs the loan to purchase cinder-blocks and cement. She dreams of seeing her children turned into career professionals.

loans.use: purchase cinder-blocks and cement

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en:
Josephat who lives in Hoima, Uganda is aged 56, a married and hard-working man enjoying his business of crop production where he deals in crops like maize and groundnuts among other items. 

He desires to diversify his business as well as building his residential house. He will use the loan money to start up a coffee plantation.

Josephat usually complains of the unpredictable weather changes whereby seasons are not stable. This leads to loss of income especially when harvests are low.

loans.use: to start up a coffee plantation.

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en:
Sobia is 26 years old and she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running his own business of selling clothes for four years. He is only one responsible to feed the entire family and to manage the household. He needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for selling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase these clothes. 

Therefore, Sobia is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. He can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profits with the help of this loan amount. Sobia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband to increase his clothes business.

loans.name: Khurshida

texts.ru: Хуршида молодая жительница города Турсунзаде. Ей всего 27 лет. Она замужем и мать двоих детей. Хуршида простая и трудолюбивая женщина. У нее есть собственный земельный участок, где она занимается растениеводством.  Этой деятельностью она занята уже более 10 лет. Ей нравится своя работа, с помощью этой деятельностью она обеспечивает семью. Она научилась заниматься растениеводством у своих родителей. Хуршида идет по их стопам. Она хочет посадить новый урожай помидоров и огурцов. Для купли семян помидоров, огурцов и минеральных удобрений  у нее недостаточно средств. По той причине Хуршида обратилась за кредитом. Она очень нуждается в поддержке. Вы можете поддержать ее. С помощью Вашего кредита Хуршида может посадить новый урожай.
texts.en: Khurshida is a young resident of Tursun-zoda. She is 27 years old, married, and the mother of two children. Khurshida is a simple, hardworking woman. She has her own plot of land where she plants crops. She has been in the business for over 10 years. She likes her work, which helps her to provide for her family. She learned how to plant crops from her parents and is following in their footsteps. She wants to plant a new crop of tomatoes and cucumbers, but she does not have enough money to buy seeds and fertilizers. This is why she applied for a loan. She needs support and will use the loan to plant a new crop.

loans.use: to buy tomato and cucumber seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Dyaa

texts.en:
Dyaa, a 22-year-old single man from Gaza city, lives with his family in a small simple house. He opened an aluminum workshop with his brother where they make windows and doors. It is a good business that provides them with a good income.

Dyaa has requested a USD loan from FATEN to help him buy raw materials for his workshop. This will increase both his productivity and his income.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for his aluminum workshop

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia tiene 50 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y su hijo en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales como cuyes, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, cuenta con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus clientes. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales así como alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos, dicha inversión le servirá para incrementar el stock de su negocio y ofrecer mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Antonia is 50 years old, lives with her spouse and son in the District of Cayaltí, on the Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque Region, in the north coast of Perú. The population there makes a living mainly from agriculture, commerce and livestock. She works breeding and selling animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, ducks and turkeys among others. She has 5 years of experience in the business and has good personal and business references from her clientele.

Antonia is asking for a loan to purchase a larger amount of animals, as well as balanced feed for their fattening. Such investment will help increase her business stock and offer a larger variety of animals to her clients, which will positively impact her income level and therefore, enhance the quality of life of her family and hers.

loans.use: purchase a larger amount of animals, as well as balanced feed for their fattening

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
This will be Arman's third Kiva loan, which he needs again for his trading business development. Arman lives in Vanadzor city of Syunik region. He has a biologist specialty, but for many years his clothes trading business has become the only source of income for his family. Arman is married and his wife greatly helps him in his business. He sells only men’s clothing in a rented place in the Vanadzor clothes market. He brings merchandise from Yerevan once a week and orders merchandise from China once a month as well. He has many regular customers who do shopping only from his stall, as Arman is polite in service and the prices at his stall are not very expensive.

This time he asks for a loan and greatly hopes to be supported again, in order to buy a new assortment of men's spring clothes and he also, he wants to buy an assortment of children’s clothes to try to sell.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of men's spring clothes and he also wants to buy an assortment of children's clothes to try to sell.

loans.name: John Bosco

texts.en: John Bosco is a hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. With the previous loan, he managed to buy welding materials for his metal shop. He is still in the metal fabrication business, and at the same time installs electricity that adds more income for him. He is faced with challenges of limited capital, however, he hopes of expanding his business to new areas in order to raise more income. He has asked for another loan to buy more welding materials for his metal shop.

loans.use: to buy more welding materials for his metal shop.

loans.name: Livingstone

texts.en:
Livingstone has a farming business that he started to generate more income to support his family. His major challenges are weather variations and price fluctuations.

Livingstone is requesting this loan to plough and weed his land. In the future he wishes to construct a house for his family and implement modern farming methods that will increase his yield and hence his returns.

loans.use: to plough and weed his garden

loans.name: Vere

texts.en:
Vere is a 50-year-old, married man, with six children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

He operates a charcoal-selling business and, at the same time, owns a motorcycle that generates him additional income on a daily basis. He also does maize farming. He is faced with hardships of weather changes and clients not paying on time. Besides that, he has great hopes of expanding his business to new areas in order to generate more income. 

Vere has asked for a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Zahida Nadeem

texts.en:
Zahida Nadeem, an active borrower with BRAC Pakistan, lives with her four children and husband in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband, the guardian of her family, has been running a mobile shop for the past 15 years. 

Her husband wants to purchase a variety of mobile accessories, so Zahida Nadeem has applied for a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan. The loan will enable him to earn more income to better manage his business and household.

Zahida Nadeem is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase accessories for her husband's mobile phone business

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan, a 33-year-old married man from a village near Ramallah city, works as a teacher in a public school where he earns a very low income. He also does construction work.

In order to improve his construction business, Hasan has requested a USD loan from FATEN to help him buy new tools. These purchases will enable him to increase both his productivity and his income.

loans.use: to buy new tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, brick, and the like to rebuild the basin and build a low wall for the corridor in her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more auto repair parts for his workshop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy papers and inks for his business.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a 43-year-old, honest, single woman with two children, who used the previous loan to pay school fees for her children. 

She lives in Kasese, Uganda, where she practices farming and owns a veterinary chemical shop. She grows crops, such as beans, tomatoes, rice, cotton, maize, and many others. She has been in that business for four years with an aim of generating income in order to support her children. 

She is hard-working and has a dream of building a residential house and being the largest tomato supplier. However, unpredictable weather changes are her biggest challenge.

Annet wants a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to sell.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more metallic scrap to sell.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is a forty-five-year-old married man with six children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. 

Bernard owns a butcher shop, where he has been for six years. He also does teaching which is his main profession. He faces the challenge of high prices of goats, and at times, they are scarce. 

Bernard has a dream of educating his children and expanding his business. Bernard is requesting money to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: to pay his children's school fees

loans.name: Tea

texts.en:
Tea is a 33-year-old, married woman, from the village, Narazeni. She lives with her invalid husband, pensioner mother-in-law, and four children. 

The family's only source of income is from small agricultural activity that is hardly enough to meet even basic needs. So, the family lives under poverty and requires additional income to cover all daily expenses. 

Tea requested a loan from local financial institutions and was rejected several times, since the creditors didn't find enough family income to be sufficient to approve the loan. 

The start up program that is a joint initiative between Kiva and LLC Micro Finance Organization Credo, enables rural poor, like Tea, to get the chance to start or re-start businesses. 

So, Tea has been approved with the loan of GEL 2,200 to start a trading business. She will purchase stocks of food products in the city's open market and will supply merchants with these products locally. She will be able to get a profit that will be significant for her poor family. 

Tea and her husband rely on the goodwill of Kiva lenders and will greatly appreciate the help since they will get the chance to make financial stability and provide good education for their children.

loans.use: to start a trading business with food products.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. Rukia dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 50,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en:
Sawsan is a 47-year-old married mother of four children, who works hard to support her husband, who's a retired soldier, in covering their family's increasing living needs and her child's school tuition fees.

Sawsan is a hardworking woman, who opened her current business in June 2014 to make sure she can provide her family with a good monthly income. She started selling women's and men's European clothes and shoes. She is well known in her region with her good reputation and special communication skills.

Sawsan is still new in her field and is working hard to develop it as much as she can. That's why she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with special winter and the coming spring season collection.

She hopes that in the future, she can open a wider shop with special decorations and partitions between diversified sectors.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with special winter and the coming spring season collection

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad, who appears in the photo, is a 24-year-old single man from Jabalia city. He started his own business, which is a stall for selling batteries and charging lights. The demand for his products is very good, especially since electricity is not always available in his city.
Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products to resell at his stall. This will increase his sales and also his income.

loans.use: to buy more products to resell at his stall.

loans.name: Kimat

texts.en:
Kimat is a hardworking woman. She is married.with four children.

Kimat is a business woman and lives in a rural area. She keeps and feeds small livestock and trades in the domestic market. She has a lot of satisfied clients amongst her buyers. This activity helps to improve her standard of living. She hopes someday she would have a permanent activity and a profitable income to improve her standard of living.

Kimat is asking for financial support from Kiva to buy additional livestock. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more raw wood for his carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La socia Ana Maria se dedica al negocio de venta de mochilas,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de mochilas.La socia solicita le credito para comprar mochilas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ana Maria continues to manage her business of selling knapsacks. Through this business, she wants to help her children move forward. Her dream is to expand her business of selling knapsacks.

Ana Maria is requesting a loan in order to buy knapsacks. She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy knapsacks.

loans.name: Glen Evan

texts.es:
Glen, de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar, tienen dos hijos, uno de ellos ya está acompañado y el otro estudia.

Glen, es mecánico, compra y vende carros; tiene su taller de mecánica y hace trabajos a domicilio. 

Glen, necesita el crédito para comprar repuestos y quiere otro carro, para poner un negocio de frutas y verduras para venderlas en su cantón. 

El sueño de Glen, es hacer más grande su taller y así darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Glen is 39 years old, he studied to high school level, he is married and his wife takes care of the home. They have two children, one of whom already has a partner and the other is studying.

Glen is a mechanic, he buys and sells cars. He has a car repair shop and also does mobile work at people's homes. 

He needs the loan to buy spare parts and he would like another car to launch a fruit and vegetable business, where he would sell them in his local area.

His dream is to make his workshop bigger and so give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his workshop.

loans.name: Kalsoom Bibi

texts.en:
Kalsoom Bibi is a 28-year-old woman and a mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a stoneworker by profession. He is solely responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Kalsoom Bibi's husband needs to purchase different types of stones to sell, so that he can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth, and earn maximum profit. But, due to an unfavorable financial position, he is not in condition to purchase stones for his business purpose.

Therefore, Kalsoom Bibi has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for his business. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband buy stones for his business.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 30 years old, single and a trader who lives in Teshie-Accra. She is an elementary school graduate and has been with ID-Ghana for 2 years. She is in her third loan cycle.

Theresa has been selling cosmetics for 4 years in Teshie. She buys cosmetics from the wholesalers and sells them to her customers at her residence. She has a sample of the products in the photo. The cosmetics business in Ghana is very good and Theresa will use her loan request of GHS 1,200 to buy cosmetics and sell to her customers. She has been able to repay her previous loans successfully, so she is happy to receive Kiva support.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics from the wholesalers and sell them to her customers at her residence.

loans.name: Peap

texts.en:
Peap is a 51-year-old married rice farmer with three children. She lives in the Kampong Chhnang province in Cambodia. Her husband is a 47-year-old construction worker, two of the children are working in a factory and the youngest child attends school. Together, they can make approximately 14.5 USD per day. 

Now Peap would like to request a loan to buy lumber and wooden poles to build a kitchen and the house stairs. With this loan, she will have enough money to buy lumber and wooden poles to build a kitchen and the house stairs. 

For her future plans, she is going to expand her rice farm, build a bigger house and help the youngest child go to university.

loans.use: to buy lumber and wooden poles to build a kitchen and the house stairs

loans.name: Las Ñustas De Quillarumiyoc Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal LAS ÑUSTAS DE QUILLARUMIYOC, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ancahuasi,provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. luz Marina ella es soltera y tiene 51 años y tiene 6 hijos La socia trabaja en su negocio de ganadería , la socia los hace engordar y crecer a los ganados y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de ganados. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar ganado.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de ganaderia, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members of this group belong to the communal bank Las Ñustas de Quillarumiyo, the bank is situated in the district of Ancahuasi, in the province of Anta and department of Cusco.

One member of the group is Luz Marina. She is single, 51 years old and has six children. She works in her livestock business, fattening and raising livestock which she then sells in different markets. She works from 8am until 6pm, and hopes to move forward in life via this work.

Her dream is to expand her livestock sales business, and she is asking for a loan to buy livestock.

The other members work selling animals, in the livestock business, running a grocery store and running a restaurant.

Luz Marina thanks those who form part of this dream through Kiva, and undertakes to pay back her loan in the established timeframe.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Mousa

texts.en:
Mousa is a 26-year-old single man from Ramallah. He works as reporter in a local TV and radio channel. He loves his job and would like to improve himself more, so he decided to buy his own tools so he can practice and gain more experience and also open his own business in the future.

He took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him buy a new video camera for his new business. Mousa appears in the photo taken while he was working.

loans.use: to buy a new video camera for his new business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cows and goats to fatten and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is 60 years old and married.

Olivia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Olivia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Olivia has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Olivia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a 38-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Rowena has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Rowena requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials and gears for her business.

Rowena has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gears for her business

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 6 years. She earns additional income from raising livestock.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients and frozen foods for her food vending business.

Anastacia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and frozen foods for her food vending business

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
Maura works hard to support her family. Maura is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Maura requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Maura has been in this business for 1 year now.

In the future, Maura would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Ten years ago Emily started farming on a small, inherited piece of land in Boito, a remote village in the Litein area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother sells milk, eggs, tea, and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Dairy farming is close to her heart, and every day she wakes up to milk her cow, and that makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit, and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. With the loan, she will have a humble time milking her cow and also feeding it. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax, and it can also protect them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. Emily believes that with this loan her living conditions will change, because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Emily waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To build a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Antonette

texts.en:
Antonette is 25 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Antonette is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Antonette has been in pig fattening for 3 years and also earns additional income from selling ready to wear.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is 40 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, snack foods, cooking oil, noodles, detergent soap, candies, etc.

Avelina has borrowed and paid back 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, snack foods, cooking oil, noodles, detergent soap, candies, etc.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is a 34-year old hard working divorced lady with four children; shelives in Kasese Uganda. She sells crude salt as a business she has ventured in for eight years to earn income to support her family. She also owns a salt pan where she mines salt and sells for additional income. She has a dream of educating her children despite facing the challenge of weather changes affecting salt production. Amina intends to use the loan to buy crude salt for selling.

loans.use: to buy crude salt for selling.

loans.name: Nii Nii Baa Hi Le Group

texts.en:
These women are part of the group called Nii Nii Baa Hi Le ('every good thing shall surely come to pass'), with an average age of 49 years. They are into of cometics, rice, grocery fruits, vegetables, and foodstuff. 

Veronica is 50 years old and sells cosmetics at her residence in Chorkor. She buys the items (cosmetics) from the main market and sells to her customers. She has been a member of this group for three years and needs this loan to expand her business. 

With four successive loans, she has been able to make good saving deposits and has improved business tremendously. She attended school to the elementary level, but decided to join her friend and learn how to trade. Veronica is standing right in the photo, with the sample of her products on the table.

Veronica needs GHS 1,300 to be able to purchase more cosmetics to sell to her customers. Together with her colleagues, they need a total of GHS 7,500 to be able to expand their businesses and they will hold each other responsible for the payment of the loan.

loans.use: to be able to purchase more cosmetics to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is fifty years old and married with eight children. She lives in Kasese, Uganda. She is a teacher by profession and has been in teaching for fourteen years. She gets additional income from farming.

Faith joined the teaching profession to earn a living. As a loving mother, she has a dream of educating her children only to be challenged by low and delayed salary payments.

Faith is an honest person who is requesting a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Farzana Bibi

texts.en:
Farzana Bibi is a 31 year old woman, and the mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a stone worker by profession, He is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Farzana Bibi's husband needs to purchase different types of stones for reselling. He will use it to increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to his unfavorable financial position he is not in a position to purchase stones for his business purposes. Therefore Farzana Bibi has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. She can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purposes.

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's stone working business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a clean cook stove

loans.name: Eldaniz

texts.en:
Eldaniz has a store. He is 25 years old, single, and lives with his parents. They live in Fuzuli region, but they have been IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) for over 22 years.

Eldaniz has a store where he sells fruits and vegetables. This is his first business and he has been selling fruit and vegetables for 2 years. 

He wants to expand his business by increasing the area of his store and selling more fruits and vegetables (carrots, pears, onions, etc.).

For this reason he needs a loan in the amount of 1,300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). Eldaniz gives great thanks to the Kiva organization and lenders for their help.

In the future he wants to get married and have a beautiful family.

loans.use: to increase the area of his store and buy more fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Al Sadika Group

texts.en:
Majida is the featured borrower of Al Sadika group. The group consists of three hardworking women, who put a great deal of effort into developing their family's living and their businesses at the same time.

Majida is a 48-year-old married mother of three children. She has been running her bakery for eleven years with an excellent reputation and special talents in her domain.

After this long period of hard work, Majida believes that her bakery needs some necessary maintenance to make sure that she can maintain sustainability. For this reason, her acquired loan will be invested in performing maintenance on her bakery. She will also increase her business merchandise with special offers on raw materials with encouraging prices.

Majida is the first lady at the far right side of the picture. As for the other group members, Hala (27, a married mother of three) is at the center. She works as a tutor and her acquired loan will be used in pasting floor tiles at her house. Malak (19, married) is the first from the left. She has worked as a tutor for three years and her acquired loan will be invested in her expected baby's needs.

loans.use: to perform the necessary maintenance to her bakery and to increase her business merchandise with special offer raw materials at encouraging prices.

loans.name: Joumana

texts.en:
Joumana is a 35-year-old married mother of two. She and her husband are devoted parents who struggle to provide their children with a good education. 

Five years ago, Joumana started her own clothes selling business. Today she has seven years of sales experience in this domain, and that helps her a lot in developing her business in a well-managed way. 

Her special talents in her domain are enough to attract a large number of customers in her neighborhood. 

Joumana is working hard to develop her business, since her previous loans with Kiva field’s partner, Al Majmoua, have impacted her business and finances in an extraordinary way.

Today, she is seeking a new loan to increase her inventory of clothes for the coming spring and summer seasons. 

In the future, she hopes to stay capable of expanding her business while continuing to keep her great reputation in the area.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of clothes for the coming spring and summer seasons.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheeting and beams.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase clothing items.

loans.name: Lela

texts.en:
Lela is 33-year-old married woman who lives in the village of Mereti, in the Gori district. She has a school-aged son and a husband who is a private worker and generates a small income. Lela is involved in a seasonal agribusiness, harvesting apples and cherries and selling them locally. To increase her productivity and financial condition, Lela has decided to start an additional business. She needs financial support to purchase a stock of clothing and bed linens at wholesale prices to sell at a profit in her community. Lela has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit.
Lela will get private orders also and will have her own customers, as she will operate at a low profit margins. 
The new business will be a great support to Lela and her family in that she will be able to make a more stable income that will satisfy her family's needs. Lela awaits your support and kindness.

loans.use: To start an additional business to buy and sell clothing and linens

loans.name: Ayşe

texts.en:
Ayse is a cosmetologist and a divorced mother of two. After her divorce she received a small amount of money from her family and opened up her own shop.

Ayse has seen first-hand how micro loans help to support women and children. With her third loan, she would like to buy products for her shop so that she can continue to earn and thus provide a better future for her children.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff
İki çocuk annesi güzellik uzmanı on beş yıldır bu iş yapıyor. Eşinden ayrıldıktan ailesinden aldığı küçük bir sermaye ile dükkanı açıyor. Çocukları ve kendi geçimini sağlıyor. Kadınlara verilen mikro kredi imkanlarından faydalanıyor. Para kazanıyor. Üçüncü kez kullandığı mikro kredi ile dükkana malzeme aldı. Ve para kazanmak istiyor. Çocuklarına güzel bir gelecek hazırlamak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy products for her shop.

loans.name: Wuilmer Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Wuilmer está integrado por tres mujeres muy emprendedoras: Jacqueline del Carmen, Alba Gloria y Yahosca Mercedes, que se organizaron hace un año, para accesar a créditos mediante la metodología grupal, para poder crecer en sus pequeños negocios que emprendieron con esfuerzos propios para generar ingresos y cubrir necesidades de educación, ropa y alimentación de sus hijos. Están solicitando su segundo préstamo con Kiva. Con el primer préstamo Jackeline coordinadora del grupo solidario logro comprar en Managua pacas de ropa usada y venderlas de manera ambulantes y Alba integrante del grupo solidario logro surtir su negocio con productos de uso del hogar.

Yahosca Mercedes: Es nueva integrante del grupo solidario, es una joven jovial de 22 años, con deseos de superación, originaria de Bilwi, casada con 3 hijos: El mayor de 6 años estudia su primer grado de primaria y dos menores de edad. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal en la venta de madera. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 2 años estableció su pulpería  en el corredor de su casa de tambo de madera, aun recuerda con gran alegría que con esfuerzo familiar lograron iniciar su pequeño negocio, iniciando con C$ 12,000 (Doce Mil Córdobas Netos). Solicita su primer financiamiento para diversificar sus productos, comprar pollo, embutidos, entre otros productos de uso domestico. Ella y su esposo sueñan con tener un negocio prospero, vender cosméticos y ropa nueva.
texts.en:
The "Wuilmer" Communal Bank is made up of three very enterprising women: Jacqueline del Carmen, Alba Gloria, and Yahosca Mercedes. They organized themselves a year ago in order to access credit via the group methodology so that they could grow in their small businesses. They launched their businesses with their own efforts in order to generate income and cover the necessities of education, clothing, and food for their children. 

They are requesting their second loan with Kiva. With the first loan, Jacqueline, the coordinator of the communal bank, was able to buy bales of used clothing in Managua and sell them on the streets; group member Alba was able to stock her business with household goods.

Yahosca Mercedes is a new member of the communal bank. She is a jovial young 22-year-old woman with a desire to better herself. She is a native of Bilwi and is married with three children. The oldest, who is 6 years old, is studying in the first grade of primary school; the other two are younger. Her husband works informally, selling wood. 

With the goal of having her own source of income, Yahosca established her small neighborhood store two years ago on the porch of her wooden stilt house. She still remembers with great joy how, with her family's efforts, she managed to launch her small business, starting with $12,000 Córdobas Netos [NIO]. She is requesting her first loan in order to diversify her products and to buy chicken, canned goods, and other household products. She and her husband dream of having a prosperous business and selling cosmetics and new clothing.

loans.use: to diversify her products and to buy chicken, canned goods, and other products.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is 49 years old, married, and together with her spouse they have been blessed with three children. She runs a boutique. She has been in this business for two years and it has been profitable. 

She plans to use this loan to buy more stock of clothes to sell. She will plow the anticipated profits back into her business and educate her children.

This is her second loan term from Vision Fund Kenya and she paid her previous loan successfully. Her future hopes are to grow her business, be prosperous and be able to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cement and zinc.

loans.name: Lirio Blanco 2 Group

texts.es: Lirio Blanco 2 es un grupo solidario que solicitan por primera ocasión el financiamiento para sus negocios en ADIM, está integrado por tres mujeres emprendedoras y coordinado por María que tiene la edad de 46 años y comercializa joyas en su comunidad tiene seis años de experiencia en la comercialización de estos productos y solicita el crédito para la compra de anillos, cadenas, pulseras y chapas. Otra de las integrantes es la señora María Cristina que tiene la edad de 46 años y es propietaria de una pulpería desde hace seis años, y la última integrante es la señora Yadira de 30 años de edad y se dedica a la comercialización de productos plásticos como es platos, vasos, pajillas, servilletas, etc., y cuenta con una experiencia de veinte años en la comercialización de estos productos.
texts.en: Lirio Blanco 2 is a charity group that is applying for financing for the first time for their business in ADIM, the group consists of three enterprising women and is coordinated by Maria. She is 46 years old and sells jewellery in her community, she has six years of experience of marketing these products and is asking for the loan in order to purchase rings, chains, bracelets and plating. Another of the members is Ms Maria Cristina who is 46 years old and has been the owner of a grocery store for six years. The final member is Yadira who is 30 years old and makes a living selling plastic products such as plates, cups, straws and napkins etc. she has 20 years experience in the marketing of these products.

loans.use: To purchase jewellery such as rings,  chains and plating

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en:
Emelie is 34 years old and married with three children.
