texts.en: Rosa is 25 years old, she studied until fourth grade. She has a partner and doesn't have children yet. Rosa has worked in a local store for the past few months, she has livestock and a small plot of land where she has a cashew nut farm. Rosa needs the loan to pay for labor to collect the cashew nut seeds for commercialization. Rosa dreams of having a baby, to whom she can give her love and time.

loans.use: To pay for labor to collect cashew nut seeds for commercialization.

loans.name: Jostus

texts.en:
Jostus is a 49-year-old hardworking married man with nine children. He used the previous loan to purchase more new dresses, shirts, shoes, trousers and other items to sell in Kasese, Uganda. He gets additional income from the sale of cassava flour and from a motorcycle-transport business. He is also a farmer growing crops.

Jostus has a dream of being rich and educating his children. However, he is faced with a challenge of market competition and high taxes on clothes and textiles. He needs the loan to purchase more new clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ngwanue

texts.en:
This is a widow with four children living in a single room with her four children in Bamenda in the northwest region of Cameroon. She has been faced with so many challenges in life, amongst which are the death of her loved ones, sickness, embarrassments from her in-laws and the misery of a polygamous marriage.

With the new loan, she will buy firewood, an axe, and a truck and also pay for the splitting of the wood because she has been doing it for a very long time now. She has a good site for her firewood sales; also, she has steady customers. More so, the villagers are very impressed because their time will be saved from not going and fetching firewood in the forest or buying it from the market.

With the profit from this loan, she will buy more firewood, build her house, pay the children’s fees, and expand her business. 

She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of its low interest and the loan will be paid in installments. The repayment duration is also not stressful because of the non-financial services offered by the organization, such as training and social networking.

loans.use: to buy firewood, an axe, and a truck, and pay for the splitting

loans.name: Zviad

texts.en:
Zviad is 33 years old. He lives in the village Kakhati with his wife, parents and children. Zviad helps the family with its agricultural business. 

He requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for his trading business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time because the creditors did not find the existing family income to be sufficient to approve the loan. 

The only source of income for the family is a small-scale family agricultural business. According to Credo's estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Zviad requested a loan from Credo to start a trading business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. The startup loan program envisages provisions for business startup and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who, regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income, do not have access to credit products. 

With the received credit, Zviad will start trading in seasonal fruits and vegetables. He will purchase fruits and vegetables from local farmers at wholesale prices and sell them in nearby towns with a price markup. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva startup loan, will significantly increase the family's income. Their income will double, and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to start a trading business with fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more new and stylish commercial roses and love gifts for his shop.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is a thirty-six-year old married man with two children and three dependents, living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been operating a general merchandise shop since 2009 and also earns income from a salary and motorcycle transport business in order to better support his family. He has a dream of expanding his business and building a residential house. However, he is faced with the challenge of limited capital and market competition. Alex is requesting a loan to buy sand and cement and pay for labor to plaster his residential house.

loans.use: to buy sand and cement and pay for labor to plaster his residential house.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a 51-year-old hardworking married man with four children. All are going to school and living in Kasese, Uganda. He used the previous loan to pay school fees for his children. 

He has been in the lodging business for eight years working seven days a week and 24 hours a day. He gets additional income from rentals and a hardware shop to earn income to support his family. Nelson hopes to expand his business in order to generate more income. However, shortage of water, power and security are challenges affecting his businesses. Nelson needs a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Popo

texts.en:
Popo is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop for the past four years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan of 100,000 KES, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses are food and household consumables.

For the past five years, she has operated an M-pesa business in the nearby town serving passersby and the people in the market. She mentioned theft as a major challenge in her place of operation. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to add M-pesa float to her business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance.

loans.use: to add M-pesa float to her business

loans.name: Gigla

texts.en:
Gigla is a 51-year-old married man from the village of Ingiri. He lives with his wife and son. There is a high unemployment rate in the region, and the family members don't have any stable activity. Their only source of income is from agribusiness. Specifically, Gigla and his wife work on family-owned agricultural land; they grow nuts and also own 2 cows and several chickens. They sell agricultural products at the local market, which generates a small income.

To expand his business, Gigla decided to purchase a car so he could access a wider market. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will greatly assist Gigla and his family, and he will be able to improve his economic situation and give his family a better lifestyle. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a car to start selling to a wider market

loans.name: Abdugafur

texts.ru:
Абдугафур мужчина 50 лет, женат, отец семерых детей. Закончив 9 классов средней школы, Абдугафур пошел работать на фабрику рабочим. Ему приходилось работать,потому что он хотел помочь родителям. В возрасте 18 лет Абдугафур женился и решил продолжить семейное дело. Он начал заниматься животноводством. На своей участке земли Абдугафур ухаживает за шестью баранами и тремя коровами. В его делах ему помогает его старший сын и младшая дочь. Абдугафур несмотря на свой возраст бодрый и здоровый мужчина, способный так же работать и прокармливать свою семью.
Абдугафур планирует увеличить поголовье своего скота, но ему не хватает денег. Поэтому он обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой. Благодарит за доверие и поддержку.
texts.en: Abdugafur is 50 years old and he is married with seven children.  After finishing nine years of school, Abdugafur left to work in a factory.  He had to work because he wanted to help his parents.  At the age of 18, Abdugafur married and decided to continue his family business, so he started raising livestock.  On his plot of land, he looks after six sheep and three cows.  His eldest son and youngest daughter help him in his business.  Despite his age, Abdugafur is a cheerful and healthy man who is capable of working and feeding his family.  He plans on increasing his head of livestock, but he doesn't have enough money, which is why he has turned to MDO Arvand for financial support.  He is thankful for the trust and support.

loans.use: to increase his number of livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials like zinc, perlin and gypsum and to pay for labour costs.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana, de 70 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está acompañada, tiene cincuenta años de vivir con su compañero de vida, tuvieron 9 hijos.

Ana, siempre ha trabajado en la agricultura y desde hace unos 13 años tienen una parcela donde tienen una finca de marañones, de donde extraen la semilla para comercializarla.

Ana, necesita el dinero para pagar la mano de obra que extraerá la semilla de marañón. 

Su sueño es, que sus hijos y sus nietos se superen académicamente y que logren lo que ella no pudo alcanzar.
texts.en:
Ana is 70 years old and has lived with her life partner for 50 years. They had 9 children. She didn't have the opportunity to study.

Ana has always worked in agriculture and for the past 13 years her and her partner have owned a field which is home to their cashew nut farm where they extract the cashew nut to sell.

Ana needs the money to pay for the labour to extract the cashew nut from the cashew fruit. 

Her dream is for her children and grandchildren to better themselves academically and that they achieve what she wasn't able to achieve herself.

loans.use: to pay for the labour to extract the cashew nut from the cashew fruit.

loans.name: Nodiramo

texts.ru: Нодирамо жительница города Куляб. Ей 42 лет. Она замужем и у нее 5 детей. 3 дочки и 2 сыновей. Дочкам 16,12 и 10 лет. Сыновьям 22 и 13 лет. Старший сын сейчас служить в армии. Младший сын и дочки учатся в средней школе. Ее муж занимается животноводством. Нодирамо сейчас идет по стопам мужа. Нодирамо выращивает скота у себя во дворе. Она начала заниматься выращиванием скота 2007 году. У нее хорошо получается управлять этим бизнесом. Нодирамо покупает скота и откармливает их 30-40 дней, потом перепродает их на скотном рынке. Этой бизнесе ей помогает муж. Она хочет увеличить поголовье скота и получить доход побольше. Из-за нехватки средств она обратилась за кредитом. Нодирамо в будущем планирует, расширить деятельность животноводства. Ваш кредит поможет ей достичь своей целей.
texts.en:
Nodiramo lives in the city of Kulob.  She is 42 years old and she is married with five children: three daughters and two sons.  Her daughters are 16, 12 and 10, and her sons are 22 and 13.  Her eldest son is currently doing his army service and her youngest son and daughter are in high school.  Her husband raises livestock and Nodiramo is now engaged in his line of work.  She raises livestock at their home.  She started raising livestock in 2007 and she does the work well.  Nodiramo buys cattle and fattens them up for 30-40 days, then sells them on at the animal market.  Her husband helps her in this business.  

Nodiramo wants to increase her head of livestock and earn more money.  Because of their lack of funds, she has asked for a loan.  Nodiramo plans to expand her livestock business in the future.  This loan will help her reach her goals.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cement, sand, bricks and iron, and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Lorenza Selmira

texts.es: Doña Selmira es una mujer preocupada por la salud de los demás, de profesión Licenciada en enfermería, con 14 años de laborar en un centro de salud de la localidad donde vive, es casada, sin hijos a su cargo, actualmente tiene la necesidad de mejorar su vivienda, por lo que visito a ceprodel, para solicitar financiamiento, el que utilizaría en la Compra de cemento, arena, ladrillo y mano de obra, para realizar la construcción de una tapia, con la cual mejorara las condiciones de vida
texts.en: Selmira is a woman who is concerned about other people's health.  She has a nursing degree and has worked for 14 years at the health center in her town.  She is married and has no children in her care.  With a need to renovate her home, Selmira has requested a loan through Ceprodel to buy cement, sand and bricks, and pay labor costs to build a wall.  This will improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand and bricks, and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina, de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, está casada y tiene dos hijos de los cuales solo uno depende de ella.

Cristina, tiene venta de pupusas, este negocio lo ha mantenido por más de 5 años.

El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar quesillo, maíz, harina, plancha, entre otros, para elaborar las pupusas.

Ella sueña con ver a sus hijos prepararse académicamente.
texts.en:
Cristina, 39, has a seventh grade education.  She is married and has two children in her care.  For five years she has been in business selling pupusas (filled tortillas).

The loan she is requesting is to buy cheese, corn, flour and a grill to make pupusas and other foods.  

Her dream is to see her children get an education.

loans.use: To buy cheese, corn, flour, and a grill to make pupusas and other foods.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
José, de 36 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene dos hijos.

José, es agricultor y obrero, trabaja en una fábrica de adobe y tejas. 

El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar abono y fertilizantes. 

José, planea en un futuro darle estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jose, 36, has a ninth grade education.  He lives with his partner who takes care of the domestic tasks and they have two children.  Jose is a farmer and day laborer working in an adobe tile factory.  

The loan he is requesting is to buy manure and fertilizers.  In the future Jose wants to give his children an education.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay university costs and medical expenses.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: Teresa de 54 años de edad es separada con 4 hijos independientes. Ella pertenece al grupo “Mujeres Emprendedoras” conformado por 07 socias responsables. Teresa se dedica a la venta de productos cosméticos  aproximadamente 12  años, le va bien. Su mayor anhelo es de poder tener su local propio donde pueda ofrecer sus productos. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de labiales, sombras, perfumes y colonias. El grupo “Mujeres Emprendedoras” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por hacer posible este crédito. Teresa es la segunda del lado derecho y viste polo morado.
texts.en: Teresa, 54 years old, is separated with 4 independent children. She is a member of the “Mujeres Emprendedoras” group, made up of 7 responsible members. Teresa has worked selling cosmetics for approximately 12 years and it is going well. Her greatest desire is to be able to have her own retail space where she can sell her products. She asked for the loan to purchase lipstick, eyeshadow, perfumes, and colognes. The “Mujeres Emprendedoras” group is grateful to the Kiva investors for making this loan possible. Teresa is the second from the right and is wearing a purple shirt.

loans.use: to purchase lipstick, eyeshadow, perfumes, and colognes.

loans.name: Mujeres Campesinas Group

texts.es:
Francisca, Paula, Epifania, Gregoria, Maria, Ma Guadalupe y Leticia son mujeres que viven en una comunidad mazahua y aún  conservan su lengua materna, sus tradiciones y sus fiestas. Ellas se conocen desde niñas y el lazo de amistad que las une es una característica que también las distingue. 

El nombre del grupo lo eligieron porque la mayoría se dedica a trabajar el campo cultivando maíz, frijoles, habas y calabazas, los cuales sirven como alimento para su familia durante todo el año. Además, también venden parte de lo que producen y esto les permite a todas ellas ayudar a sus esposos quienes trabajan como obreros. 

Doña Gregoria es una mujer orgullosa de sus raíces, platicadora, sonriente y muy trabajadora, ha vivido a lado de Don Gerardo durante 43 años, juntos formaron una familia de 12 hijos de los cuales cuatro aun dependen de ellos aunque sólo una decidió seguir estudiando.

A sus 60 años, Gregoria aún se dedica a criar animales como borregos, pollos y pavos. Todos los días, Doña Gregoria se queda en casa a atender a sus animales mientras Don Gerardo se gana el sustento para su hogar trabajando como chofer de maquinaria pesada. “Crecí en el campo, desde pequeña aprendí a cuidar a los animales porque mis padres también se dedicaban a eso. Ahora que tengo una familia es una manera de apoyar económicamente a mi esposo”. Ya son 43 años de experiencia en su trabajo y muchas veces los clientes llegan a su casa para comprar los animales que por lo regular conserva sólo un año.

Esta vez, Gregoria necesita un préstamo para reiniciar con la cría de sus borregos porque es el único tipo de animal que ya no tiene en casa. Ella está muy agradecida con Kiva y VisionFund porque sus ganancias le han permitido tener más animales y construir hasta 40 corrales. Sin embargo, lo más importante es que logró ofrecer a sus hijos educación básica “Mis hijos eran muy pequeños, todos estudiaban y los gastos eran demasiado, pero con el préstamo podíamos sacar un poco más de dinero". 

Actualmente sólo una de sus hijas está estudiando, quiere ser maestra de danza en la escuela de Bellas Artes, es el orgullo de Doña Gregoria y Don Gerardo. Aunque las colegiaturas son muy caras, sus padres se esfuerzan para tenerle preparada el pago su colegiatura entre otros gastos.Doña Gregoria desea ver realizada profesionalmente a su hija pero también le encantaría que sus hijos que no están estudiando también se motiven y retomen sus estudios para tener una mejora calidad de vida.   

Las demás integrantes también invertirán en la cría de animales, Francisca, Leticia y Maria, en borregos; Paula, en bordados; Epifania, en pollos y pavos, mientras Doña Ma Guadalupe utilizará su préstamo para comprar borreguitos, pollos y pavos.
texts.en:
Francisca, Paula, Epifania, Gregoria, Maria, Ma Guadalupe and Leticia are women who live in a Mazahua community and still keep their native language, traditions and festivals. They have known each other since childhood and the bond of friendship that unites them is one characteristic that also sets them apart.

They chose the group's name because the majority of them work in the countryside growing corn, beans, broad beans, and squash, which serve them as food for their family throughout the year. In addition, they also sell part of what they produce and this allows them all to help their spouses who work as laborers. 

Gregoria is a woman proud of her roots, chatty, smiling, and very hard-working. She has lived at the side of Gerardo for 43 years, and together they made a family with 12 children of whom four still depend on them although only one is still a student. 

At 60 years old, Gregoria still works raising animals such as sheep, chickens, and turkeys. Every day, Gregoria stays home to take care of her animals while Gerardo earns the household sustenance working as a heavy machinery operator. "I grew up in the countryside, and since I was young, I learned to care for the animals because my parents also worked in this. Now that I have a family, it is a way to economically support my husband." She has 43 years of experience in her work and many times customers come to her house to purchase the animals that typically she keeps for only one year. 

This time, Gregoria needs a loan to begin again with raising her sheep because it is the only type of animal she doesn't have in the house now. She is very grateful to Kiva and VisionFund because her earnings have permitted her to have more animals and build up to 40 stalls. However, the most important is that she managed to offer her children a basic education. "My children were very small, all of them went to school and the expenses were too much, but with the loan, we could get a little more money."

Currently, only one of her daughters is a student, she wants to be a dance instructor at the fine arts school, and is the pride of Gregoria and Gerardo. Although the school costs are very high, her parents work hard to be able to pay the tuition among other expenses. Gregoria wants to see her daughter become a professional but she would also love her children who are not students to also be motivated and go back to school to have a better quality of life. 

The other members will also invest in raising animals: Francisca, Leticia and Maria, in sheep; Paula in embroidery; Epifania, in chickens and turkeys, while Ma Guadalupe will use her loan to purchase lambs, chickens and turkeys.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

location.town: Dios Padre, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Bernabé

texts.es:
Bernabé, de 46 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, se casó en el año de 1999, tiene 3 hijos, un niño y dos niñas.

Bernabé, se creció con sus padres, quienes hoy dependen de ella, ya que son personas de avanzada edad.- Su esposo se separó de ella, desde hace nueve años y es ella quien ahora tiene que trabajar para dar el sustento a sus hijos y a sus padres.

Bernabé, se dedica a trabajar en las fincas de café desde que estaba joven, en el periodo de cosecha y manejo.- También, los fines de semana vende pupusas y tacos por las tardes; vivía en la capital del país, pero hace un año viajo hacia el lugar donde actualmente reside, pues su madre está enferma y ella debe de cuidarla.

Ella está solicitando un crédito para comprar lámina, maya, zinc y 100 pollos de engorde, para comenzar con el negocio de crianza de pollos y así poder seguir generando ingresos económicos a su hogar, para cubrir las necesidades de su familia.

El sueño de Bernabé, es arreglar su vivienda  y aumentar la granja para que pueda engordar más pollos y darles mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Bernabé, 46 years old, went to school up to the second grade, got married in the year 1999, and has three children, a boy and two girls. 

Bernabé grew up with her parents who today depend on her, since they are elderly. Her husband separated from her nine years ago and now she is the one who has to work to provide sustenance for her children and her parents. 

Bernabé has worked in the coffee plantations since she was young, in the harvest and management seasons. In addition, on the weekends, she sells pupusas and tacos in the afternoons. She lived in the country's capital, but a year ago she traveled to the place where she lives now, since her mother is sick and she needs to take care of her. 

She is asking for a loan to purchase metal sheeting, wire mesh, zinc, and 100 chickens to fatten, to begin her business raising chickens and in this way be able to continue generating income for her household, to cover her family's needs. 

Bernabé's dream is to fix up her house and expand the farm so that she can fatten more chickens and give her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase metal sheeting, wire mesh, zinc and 100 chickens to fatten, to begin with her business raising chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy zinc, purlins, cement, sand and to pay labourers and she would use the rest to purchase rucksacks, exercise books and uniforms.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José, de 49 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañado y su pareja trabaja en casa de lavar y planchar ropa ajena y aún no tienen hijos.

José, tiene un taller de reparación de bicicletas desde hace cinco años, decidio colocar el taller porque necesitaba obtener ingresos y porque es la actividad que siempre le ha gustado, el taller está ubicado cerca de su casa.

El prestamo lo solicita para comprar unos materiales que le faltan para terminar de constuir su vivienda, de esa manera lograra terminar su casa y ya podra vivir junto a su pareja.

El sueño de José, es seguir remodelando su casa, ya que falta mucho y por eso seguira trabajando.
texts.en: 49-year-old José is married and he and his wife do not yet have any children. His wife works in their home washing and ironing other people's laundry. José had a primary school education and, for the last five years, he has run a bicycle repair workshop. He decided to set up this workshop because he needed an income and because it is a job that he has always enjoyed. His workshop is close to his home. He is applying for a loan to buy the materials he needs to finish building his home so that he will be able to live there with his wife. José's dream is to continue improving his house, as there is much left to do, and so he will continue working.

loans.use: to buy the materials he needs to finish building his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 4-inch PVC tubing and to pay labourers

loans.name: Adolfo Agustín

texts.es: Adolfo es un hombre laborioso que a sus 47 años es propietario de un taller de zapatería, cuenta con una experiencia de veintiséis años, y es primer ciclo que solicita el financiamiento en ADIM para su negocio con el objetivo de incrementar su capital de trabajo y así aumentar la producción, en su negocio cuenta con la ayuda de seis trabajadores que son remunerados y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de cuero ya que es uno de los materiales que se está escaseando motivo por el cual desea comprar al por mayor de manera que no dejará de producir en esta temporada escolar.
texts.en: 47-year-old Adolfo is a hardworking man who owns a shoemaking workshop. He has 26 years' experience in his trade and this is the first time that he has sought a loan for his business from ADIM. He would use it to increase his working capital and, as a result, boost his production. He pays 6 people who work for him. He would use the loan to buy leather, as it is becoming increasingly scarce. He wants to buy it in bulk so that he will be able to continue production throughout the school year.

loans.use: to buy leather, the material he uses most, which is hard to find at this time of year.

loans.name: Abelina

texts.es:
Abelina, de 57 años de edad, no estudio, creció con sus padres y por problemas de distancia y económicos no pudo estudiar, aprendió a leer y a escribir cuando ya era mayor de edad gracias a un programa de alfabetización, se casó hace 37 años y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 4 hijos, pero todos son mayores de edad y con ella solo vive una hija y dos nietos.  

Abelina, tiene el negocio de molino desde hace 5 años, todos los días abre el molino desde la mañana hasta la tarde, también trabaja en la agricultura cultivando maíz y frijoles y en la ganadería.

El crédito lo solicita para comprar un motor para el molino, pues se le daño y necesita comprar uno nuevo para poder seguir con el negocio. 

El sueño de Abelina, es tener una galera donde poder ubicar el molino, pues está en el corredor de su vivienda  e incómoda un poco, con el sonido del molino.- Además, quiere reparar el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en: 57-year-old Abelina did not have an education. She grew up with her parents and, due to distance problems and financial difficulties, was not able to go to school. She learned to read and write as an adult, thanks to a literacy programme. She has been marries for 37 years and her husband works in agriculture. She has children, but they are all grown up and now only 1 daughter and 2 grandchildren live with her. Abelina has been running her milling business for 5 years, working from morning until the evening. She also works in agriculture, growing corn and beans and raising livestock. She is applying for the loan to buy a motor for the mill as the previous one got damaged and she needs a new one to be able to continue working. Abelina's dream is to have a shelf on which to place her mill, as it is currently in the hallway and the noise it makes is a bit annoying. - Additionally, she would like to repair the floor in her home.

loans.use: to buy a motor for the mill

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es: Sonia tiene 34 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus cinco hijos. Sonnia es una mujer luchadora quien hace todo lo que este en sus manos para dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Desde hace mucho tiempo se gana la vida por medio de la venta de frutas el cual es su principal fuente de ingresos. Con el objetivo de mejorar sus ingresos solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la  compra de mayor cantidad de frutas y de esta forma cubrir una mayor demanda que le permita mejorar sus ingresos así como sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en: Sonia is 43 years old and lives in her own house together with her 5 children. Sonia is a fighting woman who does all that is in her power to give her family better living conditions. For a long time now she has earned her living selling fruit which is her main source of income. With the aim of improving her income she is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of a greater quantity of fruit and doing this cover a greater demand. This will allow her to increase her income as well as her living conditions and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruit to sell.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo used the previous loan to pay school fees for his children. He owns a motorcycle transport and at the same time has a dairy farm, a business he started with a hope of looking after his family.

He is faced with a challenge of little capital. However, he has hopes of educating all his children to higher levels of learning. Deo has asked for a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for labor to mulch his plantation.

loans.name: Vunzu

texts.en:
Vunzu is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan of 50,000, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy steel rods and pay for labor.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
Faustino, de 37 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado en su comunidad, se creció únicamente con sus padres, se acompañó desde hace 17 años y se  casó hace 5 años, tiene dos hijos, una niña de 19 años de edad que actualmente estudia segundo año de bachillerato y un varón de 12 años de edad que está estudiando sexto grado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Faustino, trabaja en la albañilería, un amigo le enseño hace 14 años, pero como en el oficio de la albañilería no siempre tiene trabajo, así que también trabaja en la agricultura, sembrando maíz y frijoles, para que no les falten los ingresos económicos para su hogar, ya que de la familia únicamente él es quien trabaja. 

El crédito le ayudara para comprar cerdos y aves de corral, para crecerlos y cuando sea el tiempo correcto poder venderlos.

El sueño de Faustino, es poder seguir ayudando a sus hijos a terminar sus estudios y poder mejorar su vivienda, para poder brindarles mayor seguridad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Faustino is 37 years old and studied up to Grade 2 in his community. He grew up alone with his parents. He has been in a relationship for 17 years and got married 5 years ago. He has 2 children, a 19 year old daughter who is studying her second year of Secondary school and a 12 year old boy who is studying in Grade 6. His wife does housework.

Faustine works as a bricklayer, which a friend taught him 14 years ago. But as a bricklayer does not always have work he also works in agriculture growing corn and beans so that he does not lack the economic resources for his house as he is the only one in the family that works. The loan will help him to buy pigs and poultry to raise them and when the time is right, sell them. Faustino's dream is to be able to support his children until they finish their studies and be able to improve his house to provide better security for his children.

loans.use: to buy pigs and barnyard animals to raise and sell.

loans.name: Edgar Armando

texts.es:
Edgar, de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, luego decidió viajar a Estados Unidos donde vivió seis años, se acompaño y tiene dos hijas, luego decidió regresar al país, para vivir con su madre.

Edgar, desde que regreso de los Estados Unidos, está administrando el negocio de la familia el cual es un comedor, tienen unos ocho años que su madre empezó y ahora él le ayuda, venden desayunos, almuerzos y cenas; además panes hot-dog de lunes a domingo.

Edgar, solicita un nuevo préstamo para terminar de constuir un cuarto, para poder estar más cómodo en casa de su madre. 

El sueño de Edgar, es que lo visiten sus hijas y seguir apoyando a su madre.
texts.en:
Edgar is 32 years old and graduated from Secondary school. After which he decided to travel to the United States where he lived for 6 years. He is married and has 2 children. Later he decided to return to his country to live with his mother.

Edgar since returning for the States has been administrating the family business which is an eatery. His mother started it 8 years ago and now he helps her sell breakfasts, lunches and dinners. They also sell hot-dogs from Monday to Sunday. Edgar is requesting a new loan to finish the construction of a room to make the house more comfortable for his mother. Edgar's dream is to visit his children and to continue to help his mother.

loans.use: to finish constructing a room.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medicines and pay for medical consultations.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Salvador Humberto

texts.es: Salvador tiene 56 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos. Él es un  hombre emprendedor quien se dedica a la carpintería y a la fabricación de cuadros en madera. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus ingresos desea invertir en su negocio por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para comprar materiales como: madera, pega, herramientas, etc. Para continuar elaborando los muebles y cuadros que tanto prefieren sus clientes.
texts.en: Salvador is 56 years old and lives in his own house with his life companion and his children. He is an enterprising man who works in carpentry and making wood pictures. In this way he makes his living and provides sustenance for his household. With the wish to improve his income he wants to invest in his business. So he is requesting this loan from FUSAI to buy materials like wood, glue, tools, etc. to continue to make the furniture and pictures that his customers like.

loans.use: to buy wood, glue, tools, etc. to make furniture and wood pictures.

loans.name: Unity Group

texts.en:
These ladies are part of the group called Unity that comprises five women. On the average, they are 35 years old, with three children. They live in nuclear families in the Chorkor-Accra. They know each other as neighbors and friends and through their work. 

In order to bolster their financial capacity and better manage their businesses, they have joined the ID-Ghana microfinance institution and are now on their sixth loan. The previous loans have been duly repaid. 

The group members sell ice kenkey, soft drinks, padlocks, vegetables, rice and groceries.

Vivian has been selling banku and ice kenkey for 20 years. She is standing far right in the photo. She plans to use her loan to buy corn dough and cassava dough to prepare banku and ice kenkey. She sells at her residence at retail, for cash, to mixed clients. She plans to earn a good monthly revenue, which will be used to reinvest in her business and repay her loan. 

They will need GHS 6,100 to improve their businesses.

loans.use: To buy corn dough and cassava dough to prepare banku and ice kenkey.

loans.name: Mujakukakasa Group Katoogo

texts.en:
Allen Harriet is a resident of Bwaise. She is a married woman with children. She owns a wholesale shop which sells eggs.

She is a repeat client with a good paying record and she has mobilized many customers to come for financial services with Ugafode microfinance limited. She has applied for a loan of 1.000.000 to help buy a eggs for her business.

She really is grateful for the services provided by Ugafode microfinance limited (MDI) and Kiva funders.

loans.use: to boost business.

loans.name: Delisile

texts.en:
Delisile is a 24-year-old single mother of two.

She lives in Soweto where she has been working on temporary contracts as a saleslady, so as to provide for her children.

Delisile learned how to sew from her mother and has become so adept at sewing that her friends always go to her for her services. Owing to demand of her services within the community, she has decided to set up her own sewing business within her family's homestead. 

She is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine as well as materials. 

With this loan, Delisile will kick-start her business and even has intentions to join a tailoring college and expand her skills.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Sorlimor Group

texts.en:
This group consists of five enterprising members and they are part of the group called Sorlimor. They sell general goods, soft drinks, kenkey, groceries, and fish, as well as sewing services. 

One of them is a woman named Gladys. She is 30 years old, married and has one child. She has been sewing for four years at her residence. Gladys started sewing and now the business has grown through different levels of loan cycles. She continues to currently operate the sewing business. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of an embroider machine. 

The group has been taken through training, monitoring and guardians. They will need a total amount of GHS 4,900 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase an embroider machine.

loans.name: L'accomplissement Group

texts.en:
Jean is an entrepreneur living and working in Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo. For over 20 years Jean has been running his own small businesses in Brazzaville. Currently, Jean sells pharmaceutical products at his table in the market. He also sells various items such jewelry and other personal accessories. In 2012, Jean joined the community bank group L’ACCOMPLISSEMENT and leads the group of 8 micro-entrepreneurs. Now about to start his 7th loan cycle with HOPE Congo, Jean would like to take out a loan of 900,000 CFA.

This loan will allow Jean to move from just a table in the market, to opening up his own shop. He will use the money to start renting the shop space and filling it out with merchandise. Jean draws in clients with a welcoming smile, and rewards his loyal customers with small treats such as candy. In the future, Jean hopes to branch out from having just one to multiple pharmacy stores throughout Brazzaville. He hopes to travel and purchase good quality medications to offer in his shops. For his family, Jean dreams of helping his children finish their studies, and being able to send them abroad to finish their studies one day.

loans.use: to rent a new space for his pharmacy and purchase additional merchandise to keep in stock

loans.name: Montagne De Sion 2 Group

texts.en:
Gustave is a 48 year-old energetic pastry maker with a heart for helping others. His secret? “When you taste my cakes, you’ll always come back!” Gustave has been making and selling various pastries and cakes in Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo for the last 10 years. Through his business, Gustave provides employment to three members of his community who help him make and deliver his cakes. Gustave has a big vision for his business, and wants to expand his pastry-making activities and create a second business selling fabric to better serve the tailors in his community. In order to help achieve his dreams, Gustave joined HOPE Congo and became a member of the community bank group LE MONTAGNE DE SION 2 in 2013. He started out with a small loan of 200,000 CFA and is now on his eighth loan cycle.

Leading a group of 13 other micro-entrepreneurs in LE MONTAGNE DE SION 2, Gustave would like to take out a loan of 650,000 CFA. With this loan, Gustave can purchase an electric oven for making his cakes, materials to construct transportable pastry stands and start his second business selling fabric. While transportation of his cakes can often be a problem, Gustave has a vision for the future: he would like to purchase a van to transport his cakes in. One day, he would like to grow his pastry shop to the point where he can begin making sandwiches and hamburgers as well. Personally, Gustave hopes to help others through building orphanages and helping tackle poverty in his community and around the world.

loans.use: to purchase an electric oven and materials for making his cakes

loans.name: Les Elites 2 (1) Group

texts.en:
For the last five years, Beatrice has run a restaurant from her home. Well known in her neighborhood, Beatrice always welcomes clients in with a smile and has grand plans for expanding her business to opening a second restaurant, and eventually having three to five throughout the city. In order to help achieve her vision, Beatrice joined HOPE Congo in 2012 and became a member of the community bank group LES ELITES 2 (1). Within LES ELITES 2 (1), Beatrice heads up a subgroup of eight other micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Republic of Congo.

Beatrice is now on her seventh loan cycle with HOPE Congo, and would like to take out a loan of 450,000 CFA to further invest in her restaurant. With this money, she will prepare to open her second restaurant, and will purchase fresh, smoked and salted fish and drinks for her current business. Her true dream however, is for her family. Beatrice hopes to be able to purchase a piece of land for her three children and build them a home on it. She dreams of her children finishing school well and going on to study abroad.

loans.use: to open her second restaurant, purchasing additional fish and drinks to sell

loans.name: Prapapon

texts.en:
This past year was a difficult one for the hill tribe communities in Phrae Province. The price of corn has dropped to the point that subsistence farming is barely possible. Weaving became an even stronger beacon of hope for families. The waiting list for work grew faster than we could build new sales channels, and dozens of people are hoping to join the program. Trained weavers like Prapapon feel lucky to have this job security and the support from Kiva.

This is Prapapon's second Kiva loan through the field partner program. As a member of the inaugural class of Kiva weavers, she went through a financial literacy program, improved her budgeting skills and opened her first bank account!

Prapapon is an especially lucky weaver - she has three sisters-in-law and they all work together. They pool their resources, spread the work around and have a good time while they work! Each of them earns her own share of the profits and feels proud of her independence! Prapapon had a baby since receiving her first Kiva loan and is glad she has a flexible job that saves her from having to work out in the fields!

This loan will kelp Prapapon jumpstart her weaving operations by investing in raw materials ahead of the busy spring and summer hammock sales period.

loans.use: to jumpstart her weaving operations by investing in raw materials ahead of the busy spring and summer hammock sales period.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his house by building a room for his children, offering them a higher quality of life.

loans.name: Buenaventura

texts.es:
Buenaventura tiene 69 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en una zona rural del distrito de Santo Tomás, un distrito que se caracteriza por sus paisajes verdes, cataratas y relieve accidentado que le ha permitido desarrollarse mediante la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno, tiene en su propiedad 12 cabezas de ganado vacuno distribuido en 3 Has de inverna, junto a su esposa se dedican a la actividad pecuaria desde hace 45 años, también cultivan café variedad catimore, son una familia unida que se esfuerza en la labor que realiza. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de ganado vacuno lechero para ofrecer su leche y posterior venta de sus crías, generándole ingresos mayores para su familia y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Buenaventura is 69 years old and lives with his wife and children in a rural area of the Santo Tomás district. Filled with green landscapes and waterfalls, the rugged terrain has allowed the region to develop through agriculture, cattle-raising and trade. Santo Tomás is in the province of Cutervo of the Cajamarca region in Peru’s northern highlands.

Buenaventura makes a living buying and selling bovine cattle. He owns twelve cows living on three hectares of pasture. Buenaventura has worked in agriculture with his wife for over 45 years. The couple also grows Catimor coffee. Buenaventura’s family is close and works hard.

Buenaventura is applying for this loan in order to buy more dairy cattle in order to sell milk to his customers and to sell their offspring. This will generate a higher income and provide his family with a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more dairy cattle in order to sell milk to his customers and to sell their offspring.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.es:
Teresita, de 72 años de edad, no estudio, por falta de recursos económicos, es viuda, su esposo murió hace 3 años, tiene 5 hijos pero todos son adultos y cada uno vive aparte con sus propias familia, ella solo apoya a 2 de sus nietos con lo que puede.

Teresita, trabaja en la elaboración de hamacas y matates desde hace 14 años, este oficio se lo enseño una cuñada, pero además de este oficio, ella trabaja en la agricultura sembrando hortalizas y criando aves de corral, que vende en la ciudad cada 8 días y por encargo. Teresita, tiene problemas en un pie que le impide trabajar en otras actividades, es por eso decidió dedicarse a tejer hamacas y matates. 

Ella está solicitando el crédito para comprar hilo de seda y poli-seda, para poder seguir con la elaboración de las hamacas y los matates, de esta manera estarán generando los ingresos económicos a su hogar.

El sueño de Teresita, es poder seguir trabajando y aumentando la venta de productos para poder obtener mayores ingresos económicos y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Teresita is 72 years old and has no formal education owing to her family’s financial situation. Teresita is a widow; her husband died three years ago. Teresita has five children but they are now independent adults and live with their own families. Teresita supports two of her grandchildren with what she can.

Teresita has been producing hammocks and canvas bags for 14 years, a trade she learned from one of her sisters-in-law.  Teresita also works in farming, growing vegetables and raising poultry that she sells once a week in the city. She also takes in orders for these products. Teresita has problems with one of her feet, preventing her from doing other work. As a result of this, she decided to work producing hammocks and canvas bags.

Teresita is applying for this loan in order to buy silk and poly silk threads to continue producing hammocks and canvas bags. This will allow her to continue earning an income for her household.

Teresita’s dream is to continue working and increasing sales. She can then earn a higher income and enjoy a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy silk and poly silk threads in order to continue producing hammocks and canvas bags.

loans.name: Crescencia

texts.es:
Crescencia, de 53 años de edad, por motivos de escasos recursos económicos no estudio, está acompañada y su pareja trabaja de albañil, viven solo con un hijo.

Crescencia, hace los oficios del hogar y engorda cerdos para luego venderlos. 

Crescencia, utilizara el préstamo para comprar un lote, ya que está a la par de su propiedad, y ella quiere que uno de sus hijos, construya su casa cerca de donde ella vive.

El sueño de Crescencia, es comprar lotes para cada uno de sus hijos y que vengan hacer sus casas, ya que tienen muchos años de vivir lejos y los quiere tener cerca de donde ella está.
texts.en:
Crescencia is 53 years old and has no formal education owing to her family’s financial situation. She has a partner, a builder; one of the couple’s sons lives at home.

Crescencia takes care of the household chores and also works raising and selling pigs.

Crescencia will use this loan to buy a plot of land beside her house. She wants one of her children to build their own house near to her.

Crescencia’s dream is to buy a lot for each of her children for them to build their own houses. She has spent many years living far away from them and wants them to be nearer to her.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Deysi Yamileth

texts.es:
Deysi, de 24 años de edad, realizo sus estudios de bachillerato, se creció y vivió con sus padres y dos hermanos, se casó hace 4 años, tiene una hija de 3 años de edad y su esposo se dedica a la carpintería desde hace muchos años.

Deysi, trabaja desde hace 4 años en una tienda de martes a sábado en horarios de 7:00 de la mañana a 8:00 de la noche.- Antes, trabajaba en una tienda en la ciudad, pero por la distancia decidió trasladarse a una tienda que está en el mismo lugar donde reside, esto le permite estar más cerca de la familia y estar pendiente de su hija.

Deysi, solicita el crédito para colocarle las puertas y las ventanas a su vivienda, ya que el dinero no le alcanzo para ponerle las puertas y las ventanas a la vivienda.- Además, con el resto del dinero, pretende mejorar también el piso de la vivienda.

Ella sueña con ir mejorando progresivamente su vivienda.- Además, quiere hacer los baños de su casa.
texts.en:
Twenty-four-year-old Deysi has a high school diploma. She was brought up lived with her parents and two siblings. She married four years ago and now has a three-year-old daughter. Deysi’s husband has been a carpenter for many years.

Deysi has been working in a shop from Tuesday to Saturday for four years. She works from 7am until 8pm. She previously worked in a shop in the city but, owing to the long distance, decided to transfer to a shop in her local area. This allows Deysi to be closer to her family and to take care of her daughter.

Deysi is applying for this loan in order to install doors and windows in her home. She does not have enough money to do this alone. Deysi plans to use the rest of the loan to make improvements to the floor in her house.

Deysi dreams of gradually improving her house. She wants to do up the bathrooms there.

loans.use: to install doors and windows in her home.

loans.name: Les Amis De Christ (1) Group

texts.en:
Djokel is a young entrepreneur living in Brazzaville, the Repulbic of Congo. At just 25 years of age, Djokel is already two years into running his own business selling phone SIM cards and phone credit in the markets of Brazzaville. 

In order to help expand his business, Djokel joined the community bank group LES AMIS DE CHRIST (1) at HOPE Congo and helps lead a subgroup of 10 other micro-entrepreneurs. Now on his second loan cycle with HOPE Congo, Djokel would like to take out a loan of 300,000 CFA. 

With this money, Djokel will be able to replenish his stock of SIM and phone credit cards, and also being to launch his second activity. Djokel has the dream of having his own barber shop, and hopes that through a series of loans, starting with this one, he will be able to achieve his dream. The most difficult obstacle for Djokel is finding the space for his shop. At present, Djokel has a steady customer base due to his location in the market where phone accessory vendors are known to be.

In the future, in addition to opening his own barber’s shop, Djokel dreams of being able to travel. His ambition is to one day go to France, and eventually travel to countries in Asia through his profits.

loans.use: to replenish his stock of SIM and phone credit cards

loans.name: Les Amis De Christ (2) Group

texts.en:
Alida is many things: an entrepreneur, mother, and sole breadwinner. For the last seven years, in order to take care of her family of two and a niece after her sister died, Alida has run a stand selling fresh fish in the markets of Brazzaville.  

Last year, Alida learned about HOPE Congo and joined the community bank group LES AMIS DE CHRIST (2). Leading a subgroup of 10 other micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo, Alida is now on her third loan cycle. She would like to take out a loan of 350,000 CFA to purchase 10 baskets of freshwater fish in addition to some smoked fish to sell at her table. 

Alida is a savvy businesswoman. Whenever the fish arrive and are not freshly caught, she immediately smokes them to be able to sell another highly popular food item in Brazzaville. Alida hopes to one day open her own shop selling groceries and other miscellaneous goods such as candles and gasoline. For herself and her family, she dreams of buying their very own piece of land to build a house on that she would be able to live in and rent out to others.

loans.use: to purchase 10 baskets of freshwater fish in addition to some smoked fish to sell at her table

loans.name: Les Elites 2 (2) Group

texts.en:
Daniel is a micro-entrepreneur from Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo. Daniel runs a small grocery store out of his home to help support his family of five and large extended family of nephews and nieces. 

In 2014, Daniel learned about HOPE Congo and joined the community bank group LES ELITES 2 (2). Helping lead a subgroup of eight other micro-entrepreneurs in Brazzaville, Daniel is currently on his second loan cycle. He would like to continue to grow his business and hopes to take out a loan of 350,000 CFA. With this loan, Daniel plans to expand his stock, purchasing various items such as cooking oil, gasoline and sardines. Daniel has gained a faithful clientele by respecting his clients and welcoming them to his stand, often giving loyal customers a candy for free. 

In the future, Daniel hopes to continue to grow his business and to support all of his children in their studies and eventually buy his own piece of land. He hopes to build his family a home of their own on the land that his children could live in as they grow up.

loans.use: to purchase various items such as cooking oil, gasoline and sardines for his shop

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is 35 years old. She is married and has three sons. 

She has worked in retail for more than 12 years. She sells tennis shoes. She started selling only to friends, but now that she has more merchandise, she sells to friends, family and recurring clients.  

She is asking for a loan to buy more products with different models. She wants to keep growing her business. Her biggest accomplishment is achieving some financial stability and supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy tennis shoes to sell through a catalog.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz paid her first loan on time and now is asking for a second loan to continue investing in her business. She wants to buy sportswear for women. 

She has been selling women's clothes and cosmetics for more than five years, and has been able to support her children and make some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy shoes and women's clothes to sell through her catalog.

loans.name: Tenkoudougou Jean Paul's Group

texts.fr:
Mr TENKOUDOUGOU JEAN PAUL représente le groupe SIDWATA 06 SAPONE. Marié, il est père de 08enfants. Le plus âgé a 46ans et le moins âgé a 20ans. 01 va à l’école. Il a 05personnes en charge.
Mr fait l’agriculture depuis 10ans. Il s’approvisionne dans son quartier.
Il veut s’acheter 05rouleaux de grillage.
Mr veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Il ambitionne assurer l’avenir de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. TENKOUDOUGOU JEAN PAUL represents the group SIDWATA 06 SAPONE. He is married with 8 children aged 20 to 46, one of them in school. He supports 5 people. 

Tenkoudougou Jean Paul has been a farmer for 10 years. He buys his supplies in his neighborhood. He wants to buy 5 rolls of mesh. 

He plans to reinvest his profits in his activity. His goal is to provide for his family’s future.

loans.use: to buy 5 rolls of mesh.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina has been considerably preparing for the post-harvest operations of her palay (rice field) in Mahayag. She wants to ensure that she will have ample time for the threshing, drying, storage and processing of her harvest to make way for another cropping season. 

She presented her proposal to Paglaum MPC and took a loan. 

Cristina hopes to see all her children finish their degrees and have stable careers.

loans.use: to pay for post-harvest operations

loans.name: Nicasia

texts.en:
Nicasia has always had the enthusiasm for farming. She has cultivated their rice land in Mahayag and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Nicasia knows that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season. In the future, Nicasia hopes to buy a hauling truck for the easy transport of produce.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en: Herminia has a lot of experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing and caring to harvesting, in order to earn a good income. Herminia has supported her husband doing this type of work. Like a farmer, Herminia has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds that will have good results in becoming healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. Someday, Herminia hopes to purchase more rice land to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a single woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Arlene is 41 years old, and three of her children are still in school.

Arlene has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Arlene requested a 9,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell for her stall.

Arlene has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell for her stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to plant green beans and cucumbers.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 40 years old and married with three children. With three children still in school, Cheryl works very hard to provide for them.

Cheryl runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, spices, coffee, etc.

Cheryl has been in this business for 10 years. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, spices, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Dovie

texts.en:
Dovie is 42 years old and married with three children.

Dovie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soft drinks, canned goods, etc.

Dovie has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from an Internet cafe.

Dovie aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soft drinks, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Emma is 48 years old, and one of her children is still in school.

Emma has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Emma requested a 9,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, vegetables, etc., for her food-production business.

Emma has been in this business for two years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, vegetables, etc., for her food-production business

loans.name: Toris

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet Toris, one of Ruma’s agents. Toris lives in North Bogor, located about one hour and thirty minutes' drive from Jakarta, the capital city. She lives there with her husband and her two children (one daughter and one son). 

Toris owns a stall where she sells daily consumer products and small snacks, and provides mobile payment services for her community. She joined Ruma in 2014. She wanted to join Ruma because, as a woman, she wants to help her husband in improving their lives and learn about how to manage another business opportunity, as well as give more contribution to her community. 

As the business grows, Toris is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Toris improve her business, and accordingly, her community that needs access to such services. 

As seen in the photo, Toris is the one who is standing in her own small stall. She will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for her community

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.ru: Шавкат разнопрофильный мастер.  Он зарабатывает на жизнь оказывая населению услуги по ремонту жилья, слесарным делам и молярным работам. Ему 39 лет  и он женат у него большая семья. Вместе с женой и  тремя детьми он  живет с пожилыми родителями.  Для того чтобы содержать  такую большую семью Шавкату приходится  много и усердно работать. Ведь он является главным членом в семье и ухаживает за родителями пенсионерами. Дополнительный доход Шавкат получает от  выращивания крупного рогатого скота и в этом деле ему помогает жена и подрастающие дети.   Для увеличения доходности семьи Шавкату необходимо  освоить новые технологии . Также Шавкат хочет  научиться навыкам  оформления жилья  для этой цели ему необходимо научиться дизайнерскому делу и потребность в его услугах возрастет. А пока он хочет взять кредит и обновить инструменты для ремонта приобретя новые. Он надеется что в этом ему поможет МДО «Арванд».
texts.en: Shavkat is a master of many trades. He earns a living providing services such as home repairs, locksmithing, and painting. He is 39, married, and has a large family. He lives with his wife, three children, and elderly parents. He has to work very hard to support such a large family. After all, he is the head of the family and cares for his parents, who are retired. Shavkat earns additional income raising cattle with help from his wife and children. In order to increase his income, Shavkat needs to be familiar with new technology. He also wants to learn to build houses, which means he needs to learn design skills. This will increase demand for his services. In the meantime he wants to take out a loan to update the tools he uses for repairs and buy new ones. He hopes MDO Arvand will help him with this.

loans.use: to buy tools for home repairs

loans.name: Romli

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet Romli, one of Ruma’s agents. Romli lives in North Bogor, located about one hour and thirty minutes' drive from Jakarta, the capital city. Romli lives there with his wife and his only son. 

Romi owns a stall where he sells daily consumer products and provides mobile payment services for his community. He joined Ruma in 2014. He also feels happy to have joined Ruma because for him, Ruma’s services are the best. He learned a lot about how to manage his business from Ruma, as well as managing his income and saving.

As the business grows, Romli is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to his community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Romli improve his business, and accordingly, his community that needs access to such services. 

As seen in the photo, Romli is the one who is standing and holding Ruma's banner in his own small stall. He will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for his community

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en: In 2010, Emelita learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. Emelita tried her luck with a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her success to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. Emelita is borrowing another amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will give her farming income a big boost. Emelita looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in a position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios makes good income from her farming activities in Mahayag. This is how she supports her family and is able to send her children to school. She wants to increase her farm yield, especially with her higher cost of living since her children have entered college. Remedios approached Paglaum for a loan to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticides. She has high hopes that she will have a good harvest this cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticides

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en: Sergio landed at the right place for his needed capital when he joined PMPC. He knew this would be his last chance to get back on his feet after his first business failed. PMPC came to Sergio's rescue, lending him money when he needed it the most. Now, he has requested another loan for the next cropping season to pay for land and seedbed preparation. Sergio perseveres and always strives to reach his goals to provide for his family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Maresa

texts.en: "Hard-working mother" best describes Maresa, who is 34 years old and a resident of the Poblacion Municipality of Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Maresa has four children and is married to a construction worker who does masonry work. Her husband doesn't earn enough to sustain the family's daily needs so Maresa started a business, a food stand or “carenderia.” Maresa has been in business more than two years and wants to expand her food stand. She wants to gain more profit and have enough to support her family, especially her children, who she wants to send to college. In order for Maresa to make her wish possible, she needs a PHP 8,000 loan to expand her business.  She intends to buy meat, rice toppings and all the ingredients, utensils and other things needed for her food stand. She hopes to live a comfortable life someday with her family.

loans.use: to buy meat, rice toppings and all the ingredients, utensils and other things for her food stand.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 56 years old and married, residing ib Macalibre Alto, Lopez Jaena, Miasmis Occidental. She joined PMPC in January of 2012 in order to access the programs and services of the cooperative. 

Recently, she has accessed her third loan in the amount of PHP 12,000 for additional working capital of her existing business. This will help her buy a variety of dry goods to stock her store, which sells a variety of products in the local community.

loans.use: to buy a variety of dry goods for her store

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 31 years old and lives in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with three school-age children. She has lots of nipa trees from which she can make nipa thatch. She has had this business for four years. 

She requested a loan to buy sticks for her nipa thatch making. She has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Judith wants to be succesful and provide for the financial needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy sticks for her nipa thatch making

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Gelma

texts.en:
Gelma is a businesswoman in Lopez Jaena. She is 37 years old, married and a microfinance member of PMPC. 

Gelma runs a retail store selling "amakan" (bamboo mats) used for walling in houses. Running this type of business has supported her family, especially in the education of her children. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bamboo poles to be used for amakan weaving to sell. Gelma believes that having enough inventory would allow her to better cater to her customers' needs. 

She is thankful that she has signed up for membership with PMPC as her financing partner.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo poles to be used for "amakan" (bamboo mat) weaving to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 36-year-old married mother of three children, two still in school. Emma works very hard to provide for her family.

Emma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, spices, and noodles.

Emma has been in this business for two years. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, spices, and noodles

loans.name: Sidwata 07 Sapone Group

texts.fr:
Mr PAMOUSSA MARCEL représente le groupe SIDWATA 07 SAPONE. Marié, il est père de 05enfants. Le plus âgé a 13ans et le moins âgé a 04ans. 04 vont à l’école. Il a 07personnes en charge.
Mr fait l’agriculture depuis 10ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants.
Il veut s’acheter 10 rouleaux de grillage.
Mr veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Il ambitionne assurer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. PAMOUSSA MARCEL represents the group SIDWATA 07 SAPONE. He is married with five children aged 4 to 13, four of them in school. He supports seven people. 

Pamoussa Marcel has been a farmer for 10 years. He buys his supplies in neighboring villages. He wants to buy 10 rolls of mesh. 

He plans to reinvest his profits in his activity. His goal is to support his children’s studies.

loans.use: to buy 10 rolls of mesh.

loans.name: Floreli

texts.en:
Floreli works hard to support her family. Floreli is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Floreli requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish nets and to pay for maintenance on her fishing boat.

Floreli has been in this business for 10 years now, and she earns additional income from raising pigs.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish nets and pay for maintenance on her fishing boat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicks to raise and sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 64 years old, and she is married with five adult children. She lives in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. For the past 10 years, Nenita has been a farmer. She earns 2,500 PHP each month, and she has been a member of PMPC for six years. 

Nenita is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Dionesio

texts.en: Dionesio is 50 years old and lives in Dumingag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. He is married with three adult children. He has been farming with his family for 25 years. He requested a loan to pay for labor and seedbed preparation. He has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Dionesio hopes to provide for his family.

loans.use: to pay for labor and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Medarda

texts.en: Medarda lives in Pagadian City and earns a living through her clothing sales. She wants to have enough inventory to provide for her family. For her capital needs, PMPC has stood by Medarda since the start of her business. She is happy that she is able to survive the odds with determination and with her family as her inspiration. To earn more, she applied for a loan to purchase more clothing to sell. Medarda hopes to live comfortably with her children finishing their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Arcenia

texts.en: Arcenia has a collection of ornamental garden plants. She finds pleasure in earning money while doing her gardening activities to support her family. As a microfinance member of PMPC, she has sought financial help to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell.In the future, Arcenia wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell

location.town: Pagadian - Motosawa, Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en: Esterlita has mastered her hog-raising business in Lopez Jaena. This is how she makes a living and is able to support her husband in raising their family. She was at her weakest moment when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful for credit to fully support her business. She takes care of her hog-raising business through her membership with PMPC. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she can always get help for any financing needs. Now, the loan of PHP 14,000 will help her build concrete pig pens that would promote sanitation and care for the environment. She also plans to add more pigs for commercial sale. Esterlita hopes that her business will grow and benefit her family.

loans.use: build concrete pig pens

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie is 41 years old and married, residing in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She been running a coconut production business for five years with the help of her husband. She became a member of GDMPC in 2013, Recently, she borrowed PHP 5,000 to pay for the labor cost of harvesting the coconut at her farm. Rosemarie's future plan is to improve her house from her coconut production profits.

loans.use: to pay the labor cost for harvesting coconut at her farm

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita has food vending business in Cebulin, Plaridel, Philippines. She is making a food delicacy like peanut and camote (sweet potato) bars. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. Anecita is still continuing the business even after she became widowed. Her business has been doing well supporting her needs and those of her children. Anecita has local customers and also sells on consignment in stores and canteens. Recently, she borrowed an amount to purchase more kilos of peanuts, camote and flavorings. She wants to expand her existing business and would be happy to help others do retailing business on her camote and peanut bar so that they can earn for their own families.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of peanuts, camote and flavorings.

loans.name: Jorehza

texts.en: Jorehza is a businesswoman from Plaridel. She is 32 years old and married. She has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Jorehza is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Jorehza continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
Leang is a 54-year-old married rice farmer with two children. She lives in Tbong Khmum province in Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice for over 34 years. Her husband is a 56 year-old construction worker. One of the two children is working in a factory and another is working as a construction worker. The family can earn approximately $15.5 each day. 

Currently, Leang would like to request a loan to buy a motorcycle for her daughter, who works in the factory, to commute to work. This loan will help her daughter to reduce the traveling expenses and have better traveling conditions. In the future, Leang wants her husband to be a construction foreman and she also wants to pave around her house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her daughter to commute to work.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel, age 34, is from Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is married and a father of four children. He has cultivated a small riceland for their consumption. For a living, he engages in any farming and laboring activities for an hourly wage. To expand his resources, Joel decided to try a pig-raising business. PMPC supported him by providing the capital to start his pig-raising business. He sold one pig at a time, helping the family survive. He gives his best efforts to produce good pigs in order to sell them continuously. Joel is now trying to expand his pig business. He presented his project proposal to PMPC to finance the project and has applied for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional piglets and pay for bags of feed and animal vitamins. He is thankful to PMPC for financing his capital needs. In addition, he wants his business to grow and continue to benefit his family.  With his extra income, he wishes to provide his children with a quality education so they may have stable careers in the future.
