loans.use: to purchase additional piglets and pay for bags of feed and animal vitamins.

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Jerilyn

texts.en:
Jerilyn is 58 years old. She is married and has three adult-age children, and they live in Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Jerilyn is managing her fishing business and owns a fishing boat. 

Jerilyn has employed three fishermen to work for her. She personally sells the catch from her fishing boat to the fish market and neighboring towns. She also buys the fish catch of her neighbors. Jerilyn earns a good income each month doing this type of work, supporting the needs of her family. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase fishing equipment and accessories and to buy fish in bulk for resale. In the future, Jerilyn hopes to buy another fishing boat to improve and expand her fishing business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment and accessories and to buy fish in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en:
Rolly is hardworking and industrious father. He is known in their neighborhood area being a "tuba" (coconut wine) gatherer. Everyday he sells and delivers his "tuba" in the public market and earns PHP 400 daily from his efforts. This is how he supports his family. 

Rolly became a member of PMPC and appreciates the various programs and services that the coop offers. He hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which he has applied for a loan of PHP 14,000 to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for safe and comfortable living. He hopes to maintain his membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. This is what he is thankful for to PMPC as his financing partner.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for a safe and comfortable house.

location.town: Plaridel-Polo Pitogo, Bato, Plaridel, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Radilla

texts.en:
Radilla is 57 years old, married and blessed with 1 child. She has owned and managed a sari-sari store business for 20 years. Her family earns their living from this business. 

Radilla joined GDMPC in 2005. Recently she borrowed money amounting to PHP 25,000.00 to expand her sari-sari store building. This loan will allow her to display more goods in her store, have more sales and earn more income. Radilla's future plan is to have savings out from her business.

loans.use: to expand for her sari-sari store building.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is 65 years old, residing at Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Mis.Occ.  She is a widow with four adult-age children. She joined PMPC on March 19, 2013 in order to access the programs and services of the co-op.  Recently, she accessed her fourth loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to buy a variety of agrivet supplies.  These are a variety of animal feeds and vitamins for the local community.

loans.use: to buy variety of agricultural veterinary supplies for retail

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 50 years old and married. She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Gina has been doing this for four years now.  She also earns additional income from personal collection and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Gigi

texts.en:
Gigi is 28 years old and has three children. Gigi is married and has two children who are still in school.

Gigi is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Gigi requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Gigi has been in this business for 6 years now and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell ginger business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy ginger to sell for her business.

Mary Joy has been in this business for 5 years. Mary Joy earns more income from raising pigs.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of ginger to sell for her business.

loans.name: Sidwata 08 Sapone Group

texts.fr:
Mr FRANCOIS représente le groupe SIDWATA 08 SAPONE. Marié, il est père de 06enfants. Le plus âgé a 21ans et le moins âgé a 03ans. 03 vont à l’école. Il a 08personnes en charge.
Mr fait l’élevage depuis 25ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants.
Il veut s’acheter 06moutons.
Mr veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Il ambitionne assurer l’avenir de la famille.
texts.en:
Mr. François represents the Sidwata 08 Sapone group. He is married and has six children: the eldest is 21 years old, and the youngest is three years old. Three of his children are in school. He has eight dependents.

François has been raising livestock for 25 years. He stocks up in nearby villages. He would like to buy six sheep. He plans to reinvest his revenue in his business. His goal is to provide for his family’s future.

loans.use: to buy six sheep.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Celuk Rahayu Group

texts.en:
With 8 members, the Celuk Rahayu continue their loan. Based on the application of the Celuk Rahayu group and the results of the evaluation from MUK’s staff, Celuk Rahayu received an increasing number of loans. The total loan now is 20,000,000 IDR, and each receive 2,500,000 IDR. They decided to continue the loan until they have enough savings. To do a refresher on the management of the group, the Celuk Rahayu group take turns as Chairman of the group. Ni Nengah has been replaced by Ni Wayan, who had previously been treasurer. Ni Nengah has now become treasurer.

A month ago, Ni Nengah, head of the Celuk Rahayu group, informed the members of this group to prepare for repayment. This group had a 16,000,000 IDR loan amount and a membership of 8. Ni Nengah succeeded in selling 2 pigs, with the price of 4,500,000 IDR and the remaining 1 pig to be sold in a few weeks. With the profit of 1,500,000 IDR, she is very grateful for the acquisition and will use the profits for the preparation of her children's education and also to pay for their daily needs.

Ni Wayan used her loan to purchase 3 superior piglets for fattening. According to her plan, the pigs will be ready to sell in the fifth month. The profit will be used to buy a sow. She has a plan to become a piglet seller, especially local pigs. Her husband works as a Security guard in a supermarket in the city.
She hopes her plan will come true and she can improve her business by selling piglets to other breeders.

One member could not attend the meeting due to being pregnant.

loans.use: to purchase 3 superior piglets.
